During World War I, these social reformers began to target society as a whole for social engineering via government bureaucracies, arguing that their expertise would be invaluable to the war effort.22 However, as social reformers scaled up their efforts to metropolitan or even national scale, they found that their social expertise alone wasn’t enough; they needed to partner with powerful interests to implement their visions of benevolent social control.23 They found such a partner among another set of engineer-minded people: scientific managers, who also adopted the term social engineering.

管理主义社会工程师

Managerialist Social Engineers

社会改革者并不是唯一使用“社会工程”一词的人。科学管理者也是这样认为的，他们是弗雷德里克·温斯洛·泰勒的哲学，他是一位训练有素的工程师，以研究产业工人的工作方式而闻名。24 科学管理针对的是产业工作领域，力求提高生产效率。正如泰勒的一位弟子所说，

The social reformers were not the only ones using the term social engineering. So, too, were the Scientific Managers, adherents of the philosophy of Frederick Winslow Taylor, a trained engineer famous for his studies of how industrial workers did their jobs.24 Scientific management targeted the world of industrial work, seeking to make production more efficient. As one of Taylor’s disciples argued,

正如在电气工程中，我们通过将电力和阻力排列成一个最大有用结构来组织它们一样，在组织工程中，我们必须设法安排人类的力量和阻力——人类的动机、目的、感受、知识和能力——的领域，以便它们相互作用，发挥最大效用。25

As in electrical engineering we organize a field of electrical forces and resistances by arranging them into a structure of maximum usefulness, so in organization engineering we must seek to arrange a field of human forces and resistances—human motives, purposes, feelings, knowledges, and abilities—so that they interwork for maximum usefulness.25

世纪之交的科学管理者认为，“管理物质世界的相同法则也管理着社会，因此发现这些法则将带来合理的社会控制、充分就业和经济稳定的可能性。” 26这正是社会改革者所持有的工程思维。事实上，这些管理者中的许多人实际上是受过大学教育的工程师，这一事实增加了他们的可信度。社会控制的对象惊人地相似：社会改革者试图解决同化新移民的焦虑，而管理者则解决劳工骚乱带来的焦虑——即工厂里聚集的不守规矩的工人群体。

Turn-of-the-century scientific managers believed that “the same laws governing the physical world governed society, so discovery of these laws would lead to the possibility of rational social control, full employment, and economic stability.”26 This is precisely the same engineering mindset found among the social reformers. Indeed, the fact that many of these managers were actually university-trained engineers only increased their credibility. And the object of social control was eerily similar: the social reformers sought to address the anxiety of assimilating new immigrants, and the managerialists addressed the anxiety brought by labor unrest—that is, unruly crowds of workers brought together in the factories.

当然，科学管理是弗雷德里克·泰勒的创意，他试图通过迫使产业工人以预定的、有效的方式操作机器和在空间中移动来管理他们——即所谓的完成工作的“最佳方式”。27但泰勒并不是唯一一个这样做的人。他的同事莫里斯·库克“将工程学的领域从对材料和物理力的研究和控制扩展到对人的研究和控制。‘社会工程’是库克对科学管理定义的直译。” 28像库克这样的科学管理者认为，工程方法的应用“只是人类社会中所谓‘工艺精神’消逝的另一个迹象”。他们认为，在“集体事务”的管理下，工人可以控制工作构思和执行，而在“科学精神的崛起”的管理下，经理工程师将控制工作，工人就像机器上的齿轮一样。29泰勒、库克和他们的同事认为，这样的管理将使工人更幸福、更富有，从而消除劳工骚乱。

Scientific management was, of course, the brainchild of Frederick Taylor, who sought to manage industrial workers by forcing them to operate machinery and move through space in predetermined, efficient ways—the so-called “one best way” to get work done.27 But Taylor was not alone. His colleague Morris Cooke “expanded the domain of engineering from the study and control of materials and physical forces to the study and control of human beings. ‘Social engineering’ is a literal translation of [Cooke’s] definition of scientific management.”28 Scientific managers like Cooke see the application of an engineering approach as “simply another indication of the passing of what may be called the ‘craft spirit’ in human affairs,” where workers had control over the conception and execution of their jobs, in favor of “the rise of the scientific spirit,” where the manager-engineers would take control over work and the worker is akin to a cog in a machine.29 Taylor, Cooke, and their colleagues argued that such management would lead to happier and more prosperous workers, eliminating labor unrest.

和社会改革者一样，泰勒主义者经常将新移民欧洲人作为培训对象：例如，泰勒最著名的分析是他对荷兰“施密特”的研究。30科学管理者也与社会改革者一样对收集事实感兴趣：泰勒曾使用秒表测量工人的动作速度。他的学生弗兰克·吉尔布雷斯（Frank Gilbreth，另一位工程师）拍摄了数十小时的工人视频，以发现更有效的方法。31和社会福音改革者一样，这些管理者将他们的工作视为天堂的灵感。例如，库克是一位虔诚的基督徒。他对道德和工程学最有力的表达是他对导师泰勒的悼词，其中将泰勒的思想追溯到耶稣基督：“弗雷德里克·温斯洛·泰勒是有史以来最伟大的工程师之一，他一生所做的一切就是将登山宝训转化为实用、有利可图、可行的公式。” 32管理主义者也与社会改革者一样渴望在整个美国社会传播社会控制的美好理念。

Like the social reformers, the Taylorists often targeted newly immigrated Europeans for training: Taylor’s most infamous analysis, for example, is his study of “Schmidt” from Holland.30 The scientific managers also shared the social reformers’ interest in gathering facts: Taylor famously used a stopwatch to measure the speed of workers’ motions. His student, Frank Gilbreth (yet another engineer), filmed dozens of hours of workers in order to discover more efficient methods.31 And, like the Social Gospel reformers, these managers saw their work as heaven-inspired. Cooke, for example, was a devout Christian. His most forceful articulation of morality and engineering was his eulogy for his mentor Taylor, which traced Taylor’s ideas back to Jesus Christ: “All that Frederick Winslow Taylor, one of the greatest engineers who ever lived, did in his life time of effort was to translate into a practical, profitable, working formula, the Sermon on the Mount.”32 The managerialists also shared the social reformers’ desire to spread the good word of social control throughout American society.

管理主义甚至渗透到了家庭中。弗兰克·吉尔布雷斯的伴侣莉莲（另一位工程师——事实上，她是首批获得工程学博士学位的女性之一）让科学管理成为家庭的一种生活方式。33 20世纪 20 年代，莉莲·吉尔布雷斯

Managerialism even found its way into the home. Frank Gilbreth’s partner Lillian (another engineer—indeed, one of the first women to get an engineering PhD) made scientific management a way of life in the home.33 In the 1920s, Lillian Gilbreth

吉尔布雷斯设计了模型厨房，其中一个名为“高效厨房”，据说可以省去制作咖啡蛋糕的六个步骤中的五个。为了制作柠檬酥皮派，在普通厨房工作的家庭主妇需要走 224 英尺；而在高效厨房，吉尔布雷斯声称，只需 92 英尺即可完成。34

engineered model kitchens—one was called the Kitchen Efficient—and purported to eliminate, for instance, five out of every six steps in the making of coffee cake. To make a lemon-meringue pie, a housewife working in an ordinary kitchen walked two hundred and twenty-four feet; in the Kitchen Efficient, Gilbreth claimed, it could be done in ninety-two.34

科学管理在进入家庭的同时，也进入了工厂周围的社区，并与那些试图将涌入工厂城镇的移民社区美国化的社会改革者相遇。35

Scientific Management’s entry into the home was accompanied by its entry into the communities around factories, meeting up with the social reformers who sought to Americanize the immigrant communities flocking to factory towns.35

因此，社会改革派和社会工程管理派在很多方面都有交集。他们都重视效率——社会福利派希望在治理方面提高效率，管理者则希望在工业方面提高效率。两者都深受第一次世界大战的影响，将他们特定的抱负归结为战争努力，将战争努力视为确立专业知识在管理社会中的重要性的一种手段。36对于社会福利学派来说，战争是一个帮助的机会，正如一位历史学家所说，“让人们变得有道德”。37对于管理主义者来说，这是一个在战时工业生产期间进一步实施计划的机会，从而控制不守规矩的劳动者群体。两者都试图管理 20 世纪初来到美国的看似不守规矩的新移民群体。

Thus, the social reformer and managerialist strains of social engineering intersected in several ways. They both valued efficiency—social welfare types wanted it for governance, the managers in industry. Both were deeply affected by World War I, subsuming their specific ambitions to the war effort, seeing the war effort as a means to establish the importance of expertise in managing society.36 For the social welfare school, the war was a chance to help, as one historian puts it, “make men moral.”37 For the managerialists, it was an opportunity to further implement their schemes during wartime industrial production and thus keep unruly crowds of laborers under control. And both sought to manage the seemingly unruly crowds of new immigrants who were coming to America around the turn of the twentieth century.

然而，尽管社会改革家和管理主义者都抱有社会规模的雄心，但他们的视野都局限于各自的特定领域。社会改革家通过官僚机构进行运作，经常与政客和老钱贵族发生冲突。管理主义者更为成功——毕竟，他们与强大的工业家合作——但他们的视野仅限于工作场所，他们也与对大工业持怀疑态度的政府监管机构发生冲突。38作为一项社会控制计划，社会规模的大规模社会工程的最充分表达将在 20 世纪 20 年代出现的一种新职业中最终成型，这种职业借鉴了社会改革家的思想，为管理主义者所服务的工业资本家服务，并以当时的新通信技术为载体。这种职业就是公共关系，一个致力于“同意工程”的领域。这些人就是大众社会工程师。

However, despite their societal-scale ambitions, both the social reformers and managerialists’ scope were limited to their specific domains. The social reformers operated through bureaucracies, often butting heads against politicians and old-money aristocrats. The managerialists were more successful—after all, they were working with powerful industrialists—but their scope was limited to the workplace, and they too butted heads with government regulators who were leery of big industry.38 The fullest expression of societal-scale, mass social engineering as a program of social control would take its final shape among a new profession that emerged in the 1920s, drew on the ideas of the social reformers, served the same industrial capitalists the managerialists served, and took as its vehicle the new communication technologies of the day. That profession was public relations, a field dedicated to the “engineering of consent.” These were the mass social engineers.

公共关系和大众社会工程师

Public Relations and the Mass Social Engineers

大众社会工程师的生计要归功于电气工程师，他们在 19 世纪末和 20 世纪初带来了新的电子大众媒体。电报、广播、电影以及后来的电视，以及报纸这种更古老的技术，都为协调的、全国性的媒体运动创造了条件：

Mass social engineers owe their livelihoods to the electrical engineers who brought about new, electronic mass media in the late 1800s and early 1900s. Telegraphy, radio, cinema, and later television, along with the older technology of newspapers, all created conditions of possibility for coordinated, nation-wide media campaigns:

随着大众媒体成为现代生活的连接组织，信息的构造和传播也发生了变化，改变了感知的物理学，改变了人们看待、体验和理解物质世界及其在其中的位置的方式。39

With the emergence of the mass media as a connective tissue of modern life, things were happening to the texture and dissemination of information that were in the process of altering the physics of perception, changing the ways that people saw, experienced, and understood the material world and their place within it.39

很快，之前社会改革者和管理主义者塑造整个社会的雄心似乎就有可能实现：大众媒体可以覆盖更多的人，而不仅仅是那些居住在社区中心或机械车间的人。国家层面的社会控制似乎触手可及。

Very quickly, the ambitions of previous social reformers and managerialists to shape society as a whole seemed possible: mass media could reach more people than just those in settlement houses or on machine shop floors. Social control on a national level appeared within reach.

这种新权力的最初迹象来自 20 世纪初的新闻代理人和公关人员。具有社会改革意识的记者被称为“揭丑者”，他们“利用新大众媒体的力量，发起一场反对无情商人持续滥用公共利益的政治起义”。40受到攻击的企业，尤其是铁路公司，通过雇佣公关人员进行反击，这些公关人员会向报纸和杂志提供有利于行业的新闻报道，并将舆论导向有利于铁路公司的方向。然而，这些努力往往很笨拙，导致铁路公司遭到进一步的反对。

The first inklings of this newfound power came from the press agents and publicists of the turn of the twentieth century. Social reform–minded journalists, dubbed “muckrakers,” “utilized the power of [the] new mass media to cause a political revolt against the continued abuse of the public interest by ruthless businessmen.”40 The businesses under attack, especially railroad corporations, fought back by hiring publicists who would provide industry-friendly news stories to newspapers and magazines and shift the tide of opinion in their favor. However, these efforts were often clumsy, leading to further backlash against railroad corporations.

早期公关人员的笨拙很快让位于一种更有纪律的——事实上，更像工程师的——方法，即以艾维·李、多丽丝·弗莱施曼和爱德华·伯内斯为首的公共关系新领域，这些人“将新闻这一低级行业提升到一个新的高度”。他们在公共关系这个新领域借用了社会改革家和管理主义者的语言。

The clumsiness of the early publicists quickly gave way to a more disciplined—indeed, engineering-like—approach in the form of a new field of public relations, led by Ivy Lee, Doris Fleischman, and Edward Bernays, people who would “lift the lowly trade of press agentry to the euphonious heights of counselor in public relations.”41 Their new field of public relations borrowed the language of the social reformers and managerialists.

第一代公关人员使用当时的进步主义习语来描述他们的工作，这令人惊叹。由于许多进步主义者在寻求管理工业生活的混乱时，倾向于使用“专业知识”和“工程”的技术理性模型，早期的公关人员也呈现出技术官僚的面貌。42

It is . . . remarkable the extent to which the first generation of PR men [sic] described their work using the Progressive idiom of their time. As many Progressives were gravitating toward techno-rational models of “expertise” and “engineering” in the quest to manage the chaos of industrial life, early public relations men also assumed a technocratic visage.42

其中一个借用的术语是“社会工程”。例如，在《同意的工程》一章中，伯内斯将公共关系描述为“一个广泛的社会工程过程”。43像社会改革者和管理主义者一样，大众社会工程师认识到声称进行“工程”的修辞力量。

One of the borrowed terms was “social engineering.” For example, in a chapter in The Engineering of Consent, Bernays describes public relations as “a broad social-engineering process.”43 Like the social reformers and managerialists, the mass social engineers recognized the rhetorical power of claiming to do “engineering.”

他们也与社会改革家和管理主义者一样，对社会动乱和群体抱有忧虑。正如公共关系先驱艾维·李 (Ivy Lee) 在 1915 年所说的那样，“这是一个动荡不安的时期。许多奇怪的经济和政治理论正在被宣扬。” 44这样的时代需要精英专家。“群体渴望领导力，”李认为。他认为，专家必须领导，因为如果他们不这样做，煽动家就会这样做：如果群体“得不到明智的领导，就会得到错误的领导。” 45李认为，如果是这样，那么代表国家社会、工业和政治精英工作的公共关系专业人士应该成为群体的主人。

They also shared the anxieties the social reformers and managerialists had about social upheaval and crowds. As public relations pioneer Ivy Lee argued in 1915, “this is a period of great unrest. Many strange economic and political theories are being preached.”44 Such times call for elite experts. “The crowd craves leadership,” Lee argued. The experts must lead, he argued, because demagogues would do so if they did not: if the crowd “does not get intelligent leadership, it is going to take fallacious leadership.”45 If that is so, Lee reasoned, then public relations professionals, working on behalf of the nation’s social, industrial, and political elites, ought to become the masters of crowds.

李的思想深受古斯塔夫·勒庞等群体理论家的影响。46他并不是唯一一个关心群体的李。他的二表弟、牧师杰拉尔德·斯坦利·李在 1913 年出版的《群体：民主的动态画面》一书中指出，公关专业人员的工作是“新闻工程”。47对于杰拉尔德·李来说，新闻工程师可以控制不守规矩的人群并获得权力：“人民思想秘书和人民思想总统——这个国家的新闻工程师——将成为管理社会的人。” 48新闻工程师将是一个能够领导群众的“群众人”。杰拉德·李的论点似乎是基督教社会学家埃德温·厄普的更有力的版本，并融合了泰勒和科学管理者的精英主义。49他的创新之处在于求助于报纸——只要有意识的新闻工程师引领潮流，报纸就能够塑造社会。

Lee’s thinking was heavily influenced by crowd theorists like Gustave Le Bon.46 And he wasn’t the only Lee concerned about crowds. His second cousin, clergyman Gerald Stanley Lee, argued in his 1913 book Crowds: A Moving-Picture of Democracy that the job of the public relations professional is “news engineering.”47 For Gerald Lee, the news engineer could control unruly crowds and rise to power: “The Secretaries of What People Think, and the President of What People Think—the engineers of the news in this nation—will be the men [sic] who govern it.”48 The news engineer would be a “crowd-man” capable of leading the masses. Gerald Lee’s arguments appear as a more forceful version of the Christian sociologist Edwin Earp and mix in the elitism of Taylor and the Scientific Managers.49 His innovation was to turn to the newspaper—the mass medium capable of shaping society if only a conscious news engineer would lead the way.

杰拉德·李的新闻工程师理论由他的表弟艾维·李付诸实践，艾维·李“证明了雄心勃勃的梦想……设计‘宏大的公众思想统一’，正在寻找一个切实可行的推动者。” 50像社会改革家和管理主义者一样，艾维·李和他的公共关系先驱们承担了精英领导的任务，通过社会控制向群众传授美国价值观。此外，公共关系也吸收了社会改革家和管理主义者对事实的热爱。正如李所说，

Gerald Lee’s theory of the news engineer was put into practice by his cousin Ivy Lee, who “demonstrated that the ambitious dream . . . to engineer ‘the grandiose unification of the public mind,’ was in the process of finding a practical facilitator.”50 Like the social reformers and managerialists, Ivy Lee and his fellow public relations pioneers took on the task of elite leadership, teaching crowds American values through social control. In addition, public relations adopted the social reformers and managerialists’ love of facts. As Lee argued,

我们应该确保公众了解所有事情的真相，但我们应该特别努力地强调那些表明我们正在尽最大努力工作的事实，这些事实将使公众相信我们。我们应该向公众提供足够多的正面事实、足够多的启发性事实，这样他们就不会夸大负面事实。只要人性脆弱，每个行业都会有一些负面事实。51

We should see to it that in all matters the public learns the truth but we should take special pains to emphasize those facts which show that we are doing our job as best we can, and which will create the idea that we should be believed in. We should get so many good facts, so many illuminating facts, before the public that they will not magnify the bad. There will always be some bad facts in every business, as long as human nature is frail.51

这种对事实的热爱转化为一种公共关系工程方法，弗莱施曼和伯内斯称之为“同意工程”。52 伯内斯和弗莱施曼是一对夫妻，他们在 20 世纪 20 年代共同创办了一家成功的公关公司，他们认为同意工程可以通过通信技术来实现，尤其是报纸和广播。53它们的使用将以从新兴社会和心理科学中收集的事实为指导，以理解和瞄准“群体思维”。54在“通信技术人员的帮助下”，部署尖端的社会科学数据收集和分析技术他们相信，政治领导人能够通过当时流行的民意调查、调查、访谈和统计等方法，实现其计划的同意工程，而且是以“科学”的方式实现的。55群体意识的知识将使同意工程能够超越“老式宣传者”的技术，后者并不精通科学，而是通过系统工程来控制人群。56

This love of facts translated to an engineering approach to public relations, what Fleischman and Bernays called the “engineering of consent.”52 A husband and wife team who began a successful public relations firm together in the 1920s, Bernays and Fleischman argued that consent engineering could take place via communication technologies, particularly newspapers and radio.53 Their use would be guided by the facts gathered from the emerging social and psychological sciences to understand and target “the group mind.”54 With “the aid of technicians . . . of communication” deploying the cutting edge, social scientific data collection and analysis techniques of the day—e.g., polls, surveys, interviews, and statistics—they believed that political leaders would be able to achieve the engineering of consent for their programs and to do so “scientifically.”55 Knowledge of the group mind would allow consent engineers to move beyond the techniques of “the old-fashioned propagandist,” who was not versed in science, to control crowds through systematic engineering.56

和李一样，伯内斯告诫我们必须认识到，新兴的大众传播工具和技术既可用于善，也可用于恶，既可用于促进民主，也可用于颠覆民主，因此，“掌握传播技术”以促进社会建设性目标对于维护民主社会是必要的。57如果做得好，同意工程师可以成为“隐形政府……我们国家真正的统治力量” 。58

Like Lee, Bernays cautioned that we must recognize that the emerging tools and techniques of mass communication could be used for good or evil, to promote or to subvert democracy, and that, as a result, “mastering the techniques of communication” for promoting socially constructive ends would be necessary for the maintenance of democratic societies.57 If done right, the consent engineers can become an “invisible government . . . the true ruling power of our country.”58

李的新闻工程以及伯内斯和弗莱施曼的同意工程是我们所说的大规模社会工程的最充分的表达：为了控制人群而实施社会科学知识。这种大规模社会工程方法呼应了基督教社会改革家厄普早先的呼吁，即“做事和了解事物”，将大规模社会工程的实践定义为“仅基于对情况的透彻了解以及将科学原理和经过验证的实践应用于让人们支持想法和计划的任务而采取的行动”。59大规模社会工程与桥梁建设一样实用：“正如土木工程师在建造桥梁之前必须分析情况的每一个要素一样，”伯内斯写道，“因此，为了实现有价值的社会目标，同意工程师必须以精心策划的行动为基础。” 60和任何工程师一样，大众社会工程师必须应用科学：正如伯内斯经常声称的那样，他 1923 年撰写的奠基之作《结晶舆论》旨在成为一本实用的书手册，以应用传播理论家沃尔特·李普曼的理论思想，李普曼于前一年撰写了《舆论》一书。61

Lee’s news engineering and Bernays and Fleischman’s engineering of consent are the fullest expressions of what we call mass social engineering: the implementation of social science knowledge for the purposes of controlling the crowd. Such a mass social engineering approach echoed the Christian social reformer Earp’s earlier call for “doing things as well as knowing things,” defining the practice of mass social engineering as “action based only on thorough knowledge of the situation and on the application of scientific principles and tried practices to the task of getting people to support ideas and programs.”59 Mass social engineering is every bit as practical as bridge building: “Just as the civil engineer must analyze every element of the situation before he builds a bridge,” Bernays wrote, “so the engineer of consent, in order to achieve a worth-while social objective, must operate from a foundation of soundly planned action.”60 And like any engineer, the mass social engineer has to apply science: as Bernays often claimed, his foundational book Crystallizing Public Opinion, written in 1923, was meant to be a practical manual to apply the theoretical ideas of communication theorist Walter Lippman, who wrote his book Public Opinion the year prior.61

弗莱施曼阐明了工程方法，主张一种公关专业人士至今仍在使用的方法：研究、计划、沟通、评估。62在1935 年的一次演讲中，弗莱施曼呼吁女性时尚行业采用这种方法，制定更有效的宣传计划，以“工程精确度”传达最新时尚。63 “以此为基础，”她告诉听众，

Fleischman clarified the engineering approach, arguing for a methodology that public relations professionals continue to use to this day: research, plan, communicate, evaluate.62 In a 1935 speech, Fleischman called for the women’s fashion industry to adopt this method for a more efficient propaganda program that could communicate the latest fashions with “engineering exactness.”63 “With this as a basis,” she informs her audience,

你将为公众定下基调，你将消除浪费……并使你真正能够毫无损失地、以最大的效率、最终得到公众和各个行业的全心全意认可地利用宣传工具和技术。64

you will set the keynote for the public, you will eliminate waste . . . and enable yourself really to avail yourself of the tools and techniques of propaganda without loss, with fullest efficiency and ultimately with the wholehearted approval of the public and the individual industries.64

因此，就像那些收集目标社区数据的社会改革者，或那些注重效率的工作动作研究的管理者一样，李、伯内斯和弗莱施曼为大众社会工程学规定了一种方法：获取事实，研究公众，辨别影响他们的心理方式，并与他们沟通，最好是通过制造有新闻价值的事件。65 （事实上，正如我们将在下一章中展示的那样，这种基本模式将在人际黑客社会工程学中再次出现。）

Thus, much like the social reformers who gathered data on their target neighborhoods, or the managerialists with their efficiency-minded work motion studies, Lee, Bernays, and Fleischman prescribed a method for mass social engineers: get the facts, study the public, discern psychological ways to influence them, and communicate with them, ideally by creating newsworthy events.65 (Indeed, as we will show in the next chapter, this basic pattern will reappear in interpersonal hacker social engineering.)

但与社会改革家或管理学家相比，他们的方法更为广泛。大规模社会工程学在美国生活的各个领域都有广泛的应用，从消费（例如弗莱施曼对时尚业的建议）到对工业的支持（例如李对铁路的工作）再到对战争的努力的支持（例如伯内斯作为第一次世界大战 Creel 委员会成员的工作）。这是大规模的群体控制。总的来说，如果大规模社会工程学成功了，伯内斯著名的论点是“通过言语传达的思想将成为人民自身不可或缺的一部分。” 66

But more so than social reformers or managerialists, their approach was expansive. Mass social engineering had wide applications across every domain of American life, from consumption (e.g., Fleischman’s recommendations to the fashion industry) to support for industry (e.g., Lee’s work for the railroads) to support for war efforts (e.g., Bernays’s work as part of the World War I Creel Committee). This was crowd mastery on a large scale. Overall, if the mass social engineer is successful, Bernays famously argued “the ideas conveyed by the words will become part and parcel of the people themselves.”66

和之前的社会改革家一样，伯内斯、弗莱施曼及其同事们将自己展现为政治中立的“大众的超然操纵者”。67大规模社会工程必须看起来不涉及政治才能有效：

Like the social reformers before them, Bernays, Fleischman, and their colleagues presented themselves as politically neutral, “detached manipulators” of the masses.67 Mass social engineering had to appear to be apolitical to be effective:

对于像伯内斯这样有自我意识的“专业人士”来说，专业的超然态度当然是值得骄傲的一点，也是一个强大的卖点，因为这种强硬的态度可以向潜在客户心照不宣地保证，宣传人员的工作不仅仅是凭本能或情绪，而是像任何医生或律师一样公正，必要时甚至无情。68

For self conscious “professionals” such as Bernays, expert detachment was, of course, a point of pride—and a strong selling-point, as that hard attitude provided tacit reassurance to potential clients that the propagandist worked not just by instinct or mood, but as impartially, and, if need be, ruthlessly as any doctor or attorney.68

或者，我们可以补充说，像工程师一样公正，甚至无情。

Or, we might add, as impartially and even ruthlessly as an engineer.

“社会工程学”成为贬义词

“Social Engineering” Becomes a Pejorative

然而，大规模社会工程早已成为贬义词。事实上，正如工程师塞缪尔·弗洛尔曼 (Samuel Florman) 在 1976 年指出的那样，到 20 世纪中叶到 70 年代，从民用工程到社会工程，所有形式的工程都受到了攻击。69工程的黄金时代已经结束。就其本身而言，到 20 世纪末，大规模社会工程在最好的情况下被视为失败，在最坏的情况下被视为极权主义之路，被斥为纯粹的宣传或被视为控制公众的玩世不恭的企图。弗洛尔曼在关于工程衰落的章节中总结了工程最明显的失败：它未能将“正确的理由”应用于社会问题：

However, mass social engineering has long since become a pejorative. Indeed, as the engineer Samuel Florman noted in 1976, by the middle of the twentieth century into the 1970s, all forms of engineering, from civil to social, came under attack.69 The Golden Age of Engineering had come to an end. For its part, by the tail end of the twentieth century, mass social engineering was seen as a failure at best and the path to totalitarianism at worst, dismissed as mere propaganda or feared as a cynical attempt to control the public. Florman concluded his chapter on the fall of engineering with engineering’s most glaring failure: its failure to apply “right reason” to social problems:

至于最终的希望，即工程师的理性思维将为解决社会问题指明方向，每个令人难以置信的动荡日子中发生的意外事件都令人信服地证明了那是多么天真的自负。……回想起来，工程黄金时代的理想和梦想似乎是愚蠢和不成熟的。70

As for the ultimate hope, that the engineer’s rational thinking would show the way toward solutions of society’s problems, the unanticipated events of each incredible, tumultuous day demonstrate convincingly what a naïve conceit that was. . . . In retrospect, the ideals and dreams of engineering’s Golden Age seem foolish and immature.70

大规模社会工程学之所以受到攻击，部分原因是，尽管他们声称保持中立，并声称热爱事实，大规模社会工程学很快就被揭露为一种为自私自利的精英服务的欺骗性和操纵性做法。即使是最乐观的公共关系史著作，例如公共关系学者斯科特·卡特利普的《看不见的力量》，也记录了许多大规模社会工程学的案例，他们隐藏着对幌子公司背后强大客户的维护，并省略事实——甚至直接撒谎——以便尽可能地向客户展示最好的一面。71将这些欺骗行为与精英主义的自负结合起来，即少数特权阶层需要掌握美国民主的“群众”，我们就有足够的理由谴责大规模社会工程学。

Part of the reason mass social engineering came under attack was that, despite the claims to neutrality and the professed love of facts, mass social engineering was quickly exposed as a deceptive, manipulative practice in service of self-interested elites. Even the most sanguine history of public relations, such as public relations scholar Scott Cutlip’s The Unseen Power, documents many occasions where mass social engineers hide their advocacy for the powerful clients behind front groups and omit facts—or even outright lie—in order to present their clients in the best possible light.71 Combine these deceptions with the elitist conceit that a privileged few needed to master the “crowds” of American democracy, and there are plenty of reasons to decry mass social engineering.

事实上，到了 20 世纪 70 年代，“社会工程学”一词就带上了贬义，至今仍是如此，特别是对于那些对进步主义过度行为以及林登·约翰逊的“大社会”作出反应的美国右翼政客来说。早在 1955 年，威廉·F·巴克利 (William F. Buckley Jr.) 的新杂志《国家评论》就以“我们的使命宣言”开篇，其中指出：“我们这个时代的深刻危机本质上是社会工程师与真理信徒之间的冲突，前者试图调整人类以符合科学乌托邦，后者捍卫有机道德秩序。” 72这种保守的道德真理与自由的社会工程师的观点主要针对社会工程学的社会改革元素，而不一定针对伯内斯等人的大众媒体实践。

Indeed, by the 1970s, the term “social engineering” took on the pejorative meaning it keeps with it to this day, particularly for thinkers on the American political right reacting to perceived excesses of Progressivism as well as Lyndon B. Johnson’s Great Society. As early as 1955, William F. Buckley Jr.’s new National Review magazine began with “Our Mission Statement,” which noted that, “The profound crisis of our era is, in essence, the conflict between the Social Engineers, who seek to adjust mankind to conform with scientific utopias, and the disciples of Truth, who defend the organic moral order.”72 This vision of the conservative, moral Truth versus the liberal Social Engineers is mainly aimed at the social reform element of social engineering, not necessarily the mass media practices of people like Bernays.

但保守派也对他们所认为的大众传媒社会工程学提出了批评。一个例子是尼克松的竞选策略师和保守派专栏作家凯文·菲利普斯在 1975 年出版的《媒体政治：通信时代的美国政党和政治》。73在《媒体政治》一书中，菲利普斯扩展了巴克利的论点。菲利普斯首先描述了“知识精英”——“媒体、教育家和城市规划者” 74——他们试图利用他们的社会科学知识通过新的通信技术来设计社会，以符合他们的伟大社会愿景，特别是在性革命或收入再分配方面，菲利普斯称之为“贫民窟”。反对菲利普斯反对知识精英，反对广大“中产阶级”，他们对这种自上而下的控制及其伴随的税收深感沮丧，他声称，中产阶级只想要自由贸易、开放市场，不讨论种族或种族赔偿，当然也不想要变态性行为。这种反对种族正义或女性或酷儿性解放的思想至今仍存在于美国保守派思想中。例如，在 2010 年《华尔街日报》的一篇人物简介中，保守派出版商埃米特·泰瑞尔将保守派观点与自由派观点进行了对比：

But conservatives also found fault with what they saw as mass mediated social engineering. An example is Nixon campaign strategist and conservative columnist Kevin Phillips’s book Mediacracy: American Parties and Politics in the Communications Age in 1975.73 Throughout Mediacracy, Phillips expanded Buckley’s thesis. Phillips first describes the “knowledge elites”—“media, educators, and city planners”74—who seek to use their social scientific knowledge to engineer society via the new communication technologies to match their Great Society vision, especially in terms of sexual revolution or income redistribution to what Phillips called the “ghettos.” Against this knowledge elite, Phillips counterposed the vast “middle class” who are deeply frustrated from such top-down control and its attendant taxation, who (he claimed) merely want free exchange, open markets, and no discussion of race or racial reparations and definitely no deviant sexuality. Such opposition to racial justice or sexual liberation for women or queer people continues in American conservative thinking to this day. For example, in a 2010 Wall Street Journal profile, conservative publisher Emmett Tyrrell contrasts the conservative vision with the liberal:

泰瑞尔先生发现自由主义者的态度和他们的政策一样令人恼火：“他们三代人都坚持的唯一政治价值观就是骚扰邻居。”他补充道，如果保守主义是一种气质，那么“自由主义就是一种焦虑——对生命、自由和追求幸福的焦虑，这解释了他们渴望强制、征税、进行社会工程。” 75

Mr. Tyrrell finds liberals’ attitudes to be as vexing as their policies: “There is only one political value that they have stood by through three generations, and that is the political value of disturbing your neighbor.” If conservatism is a temperament, he adds, “liberalism is an anxiety—an anxiety about life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness, which explains their eagerness to coerce, to tax, to social-engineer.”75

然而，尽管保守派将“社会工程”与左派政治联系起来，但认为左派政治不加批判地支持大规模社会工程是不公平的。例如，1959 年，社会学家 C. Wright Mills 出版了《社会学想象力》，其中包括对量化社会科学的严厉谴责：

However, despite conservative articulations of “social engineering” with left politics, it’s not fair to suggest that the political left uncritically supported mass social engineering. For example, in 1959, the sociologist C. Wright Mills published The Sociological Imagination, which included a scathing indictment of quantitative social sciences:

在各种社会科学学派使用的口号中，最常出现的就是“社会科学的目的是预测和控制人类行为”。如今，在某些圈子里，我们也经常听到关于“人类工程”的言论——一个定义不明确的短语，经常被误认为是一个明确而明显的目标。人们认为它明确而明显，因为它建立在“主宰自然”和“主宰社会”之间不容置疑的类比之上。76 [人类工程师的]政治哲学包含在这样一种简单的观点中：如果人类现在已经控制了原子，那么只要使用科学方法来“控制社会行为”，人类的问题就会很快得到解决，和平与富足就会得到保证。77

Among the slogans used by a variety of schools of social science, none is so frequent as, “The purpose of social science is the prediction and control of human behavior.” Nowadays, in some circles we also hear much about “human engineering”—an undefined phrase often mistaken for a clear and obvious goal. It is believed to be clear and obvious because it rests upon an unquestioned analogy between “the mastery of nature” and “the mastery of society.”76 [The human engineers’] political philosophy is contained in the simple view that if only The Methods of Science, by which man now has come to control the atom, were employed to “control social behavior,” the problems of mankind would soon be solved, and peace and plenty assured for all.77

对于米尔斯来说，这种社会工程（或他所说的“人类工程”）反映了一种麻木的官僚心态，在这种心态中，技术官僚精英将所有人类行为简化为可测量的。

For Mills, such social engineering (or “human engineering,” as he calls it) reflects a deadening bureaucratic mindset in which technocratic elites reduce all human behavior to whatever can be measured.

到了 20 世纪 70 年代，斯图尔特·埃文等左翼思想家开始谴责伯内斯、艾维·李和其他“意识领袖”的努力，指责他们不仅仅是将人类简化为原子。78埃文主要关注的是消费主义的破坏性崛起。79 埃文认为，“同意工程”是美国社会从基本自给自足的农业社会转变为大众消费文化的更大转变的一部分，在这种文化中，生活的方方面面都被用来支持资本主义。在 19 世纪，工业家训练工人满足工厂的需求之后，20 世纪出现的产品过剩迫使资本家“制造客户”来消费这些商品。80工人被迫生产以消费，进步时代的社会改革让位于将汽车和洗衣机的所有权与美好生活的拥有混为一谈。但到了 1976 年他发表分析时，“美国人越来越质疑”同意工程的消费主义逻辑。81尤恩认为，民权运动、学生运动和妇女运动等社会运动必须摆脱大众文化的沉重负担，而大众文化正是同意工程试图强加给国家的文化。82

By the 1970s, thinkers on the left like Stuart Ewen decried the efforts of Bernays, Ivy Lee, and other “captains of consciousness,” blaming them for more than just the deadening reduction of humans to atoms.78 Ewen’s major concern is with the destructive rise of consumerism.79 As Ewen argues, “consent engineering” was part and parcel of a larger transformation of American society from a largely self-sufficient agrarian society into a mass culture of consumption, where every facet of life was conditioned to support capitalism. After industrialists had disciplined workers to meet the needs of factories in the nineteenth century, the glut of products that emerged in the twentieth century compelled capitalists to “manufacture customers” to consume those goods.80 Workers were compelled to produce in order to consume, and the social reforms of the progressive era gave way to confusing the ownership of cars and washing machines with the possession of a good life. But, by the time of his analysis in 1976, “Americans have increasingly questioned” the consumerist logics of consent engineering.81 Ewen argued that the social movements like the civil rights, students’, and women’s movements had to slough off the deadening weight of mass culture, the very culture the engineers of consent were seeking to foist on the nation.82

甚至公共关系领域本身也开始拒绝社会工程学作为一种方法。1962 年，一位公共关系从业者毫不含糊地批评了伯内斯和弗莱施曼的“同意工程”：

Even the field of public relations itself began to reject social engineering as an approach. In 1962, a public relations practitioner was not too subtle in his critique of Bernays and Fleischman’s “engineering of consent”:

“同意工程”意味着使用所有说服和沟通的手段，让其他人顺从或违背他们的意愿，接受一些预先安排好的结论，不管他们是否符合公众利益。我不能不禁想到，将“同意工程”路线推向逻辑结论，就像脖子后面挂着一把手枪，让人想起纳粹时代，在铁幕后面也并非闻所未闻。83

The “engineering of consent” implies the use of all the mechanics of persuasion and communication to bend others, either with their will or against their will, to some prearranged conclusion, whether or not their reaching that conclusion is in the public interest. I can’t help but think that carrying the “engineering of consent” line to a logical conclusion is the pistol at the back of the neck, reminiscent of Nazi times and not unknown behind the Iron Curtain.83

正如弗洛曼在 1976 年所哀叹的那样，“工程师”的内涵已经脱离了其与现代主义进步领域的联系，并被重新定义为政府特工和营销人员的僵化一致性，两者都通过大众媒体信息控制人群。甚至连公共关系专业人士——李、伯内斯和弗莱施曼的同事——都谴责了工程社会这一理念。

As Florman lamented in 1976, the connotation of “engineer” had been torn from its associations with the modernist realm of progress and had been rearticulated with visions of jackbooted government agents and the deadening conformity of marketers, both controlling crowds through mass mediated messages. Even public relations professionals—colleagues of Lee, Bernays, and Fleischman—decried the very idea of engineering society.

结论

Conclusion

总体而言，精英技术官僚通过通信技术大规模实施社会科学知识的做法，从现代主义愿景变成了可怕的噩梦。到 20 世纪 90 年代尤恩采访伯内斯时，伯内斯的精英主义态度已经过时，是工程师统治世界的时代的遗留。

Overall, then, elite technocrats’ implementation of social science knowledge to engineer society at the mass scale via communication technology went from a modernist vision to a fearsome nightmare. By the time Ewen interviewed Bernays in the 1990s, Bernays’s elitist attitudes were passé, a holdover from a time when engineers ran the world.

然而，我们应该注意到，伯内斯、弗莱施曼和李等大众社会工程师在 20 世纪 20 年代发展起来的底层逻辑仍然在我们心中根深蒂固。毕竟，公共关系仍然是一项重要的职业。如今，它有时会有不同的绰号：战略传播或政治传播——也许是为了摆脱“公共关系”的旧含义，就像“公共关系”原本是为了取代旧术语“宣传”一样。尽管名称发生了变化，但当代战略传播和政治传播领域往往呼应了旧大众社会工程的思维方式。请考虑一下当代对政治传播者的定义：

And yet, we should note that the underlying logics developed in the 1920s by mass social engineers such as Bernays, Fleischman, and Lee are still very much with us. Public relations, after all, is still a major occupation. These days, it sometimes goes by different monikers: strategic communication or political communication—perhaps to shake off the old connotations of “public relations,” just as “public relations” was meant to supplant the older term “propaganda.” Despite these name changes, the contemporary fields of strategic communication and political communication often echo the older mass social engineering ways of thinking. Consider this contemporary definition of political communicators as people who

在涉及政治权力的行使和资源配置的重大问题上建立政治共识或同意社会层面。这包括影响选举投票以及立法者或行政人员的公共政策决策的努力。在国际层面，这包括支持公共外交和军事稳定的沟通。84

build political consensus or consent on important issues involving the exercise of political power and the allocation of resources in society. This includes efforts to influence voting in elections as well as public policy decisions by lawmakers or administrators. On the international level, this includes communications in support of public diplomacy and military stabilization.84

“建立同意”。也许同意不再需要由强大的社会行为者（无论是企业还是政府）来设计，而是需要通过建立来获得。

“Building consent.” Perhaps consent is no longer to be engineered by powerful social actors—whether corporate or governmental—but is instead meant to be built.

此外，具有大规模野心的社会工程学以一种奇怪的新形式回归，我们称之为“大众个人社会工程学”，将大众信息与个性化信息混合在一起。通过新的企业社交媒体，强大的参与者可以将“政治交流变成一种日益个性化、私人的交易……，从根本上重塑公共领域，首先是通过使其越来越不公开，因为这些方法既可用于分析，也可用于与公共领域之外的选民进行个人互动。” 85

Moreover, social engineering with mass scale ambitions has returned in a strange new form, the one we’re calling “masspersonal social engineering,” mixing mass with personalized messaging. Via the new corporate social media, powerful actors can turn “political communication into an increasingly personalized, private transaction . . . , [which] fundamentally reshapes the public sphere, first and foremost by making it less and less public as these approaches can be used to both profile and interact individually with voters outside the public sphere.”85

但要理解大规模社会工程如何变成大规模个人化形式（以个人为目标，但着眼于影响整个社会），我们必须考虑“社会工程”的另一层含义，这种含义是在 20 世纪 70 年代大规模社会工程受到批判时出现的。这种形式是人际社会工程，由电话盗用者和黑客开发。我们接下来会谈到他们。

But to understand how mass social engineering can become a masspersonal form—targeting individuals but with an eye towards shaping entire swathes of society—we have to consider the other meaning of “social engineering” that emerged just as mass social engineering was being critiqued in the 1970s. That form is interpersonal social engineering, a form developed by phone phreaks and hackers. We turn to them next.

2

2

黑客与黑客：人际社会工程的兴起，1976 年至今

Phreaks and Hackers: The Rise of Interpersonal Social Engineering, 1976–Present

工程学就是你用扳手拧紧螺栓，然后转动它，然后就会发生一些事情。社会工程学就是你拿起电话，找一个笨得像螺栓一样的人，然后转动它。

Engineering is when you take a wrench to a bolt, turn it, and something happens. Social engineering is when you take a telephone, get somebody who’s dumb as a bolt on the other end, and turn it.

—Chesire Catalyst 1

—Chesire Catalyst1

尽管到 20 世纪 70 年代，大规模社会工程学已广受诟病，但社会工程学本身的理念并未就此消亡。正当美国人谴责精英技术官僚想要大规模操纵认知时，一种新的、更个人化的社会工程学形式出现了。它将与计算机黑客和电话盗用者文化联系最为紧密。

Although mass social engineering was widely vilified by the 1970s, the idea of social engineering itself did not die out at that time. While Americans were decrying the idea that elite technocrats wanted to engineer perceptions on a mass scale, a new, more personal form of social engineering emerged. It will be most associated with computer hacker and phone phreak cultures.

在许多方面，这种新形式似乎与旧的大众形式截然不同。大众社会工程师试图通过大众媒体信息掌握“人群”，而电话飞客和黑客的目标则截然不同：分别访问电话和计算机网络。大众社会工程师想要塑造整个社会，而电话飞客和黑客则快速、熟练地操纵电话操作员或计算机实验室管理员——他们的目标是个人，他们的方法更类似于人际交流而非大众传播。尽管大众社会工程师借鉴了当时的新社会科学，但飞客和黑客的做法——至少在一开始——是一种诙谐、本能、地下的做法。

In many ways, this new form appears to be quite different from the older, mass form. Whereas mass social engineers sought to master “the crowd” via mass media messaging, phone phreaks and hackers had a very different goal in mind: access to telephone and computer networks, respectively. While the mass social engineers wanted to shape society as a whole, the phreaks and hackers engaged in quick, instrumental manipulations of telephone operators or computer lab administrators—their targets were individuals and their approach was more akin to interpersonal communication than mass communication. And while the mass social engineers drew from the new social sciences of their day, the phreak and hacker practice was—at least at first—a jocular, instinctual, underground practice.

但大众黑客和人际黑客的社会工程形式有很多联系。正如网络安全学者约瑟夫·哈特菲尔德所说，大众黑客和人际黑客之间存在一些概念和语义上的重叠。2此外，大众个人社会工程是这两种社会工程形式的综合体，如今仍然存在。

But the mass and interpersonal hacker forms of social engineering have many connections. As cybersecurity scholar Joseph Hatfield argues, there are several conceptual and semantic overlaps between mass and interpersonal social engineering.2 Moreover, masspersonal social engineering, a synthesis of these two forms of social engineering, is with us today.

黑客社会工程学的思想根源

Intellectual Roots of Hacker Social Engineering

一种新型社会工程学的出现源于人们对旧式大众社会工程学的恐惧，尤其是对政府或企业行为者进行大众操纵的恐惧。大众文化——取决于个人的政治倾向——要么是政府过度干预人们生活的症状，要么是消费资本主义的僵化一致性和破产价值观的症状。

A new form of social engineering emerges from the fears of the older mass social engineering, particularly the fears of mass manipulation carried out by government or corporate actors. Mass culture was—depending on one’s political predilections—either a symptom of governmental overreach in people’s lives, or a symptom of the deadening conformity and bankrupt values of consumer capitalism.

到了二十世纪中叶，社会运动和知识分子试图通过倡导新形式的个性化技术和技巧来超越大众文化。美国小说家汤姆·沃尔夫在 1976 年将这一时期称为著名的“自我十年”。3转向个人的趋势以三种形式出现。首先是新公社主义思想，始于 20 世纪 60 年代人们对个人技术的兴趣日益浓厚，并延续到当代互联网文化。其次是转向自助和个人治疗文化。第三是新自由主义经济学的超个人主义。这三种趋势都将继续影响人际社会工程。

By the mid-twentieth century, social movements and intellectuals sought to move beyond mass culture by championing new forms of individualized technologies and techniques. This was the period the American novelist Tom Wolfe famously dubbed the “Me Decade” in 1976.3 The turn to the individual appeared in three forms. First was New Communalist thinking, starting with growing interest in personal technologies in the 1960s carrying through to contemporary internet culture. Second was the turn to self-help and individual therapeutic cultures. Third was the hyper-individualism of neoliberal economics. All three would go on to inform interpersonal social engineering.

首先，传播学者弗雷德·特纳在《从反主流文化到赛博文化》一书中对斯图尔特·布兰德的精彩描述，展示了向个人、解放技术的转变。4布兰德是典型的新公社主义者，也是 20 世纪 60 年代回归土地运动的领导者。虽然“回归土地”意味着一种新的田园生活，但布兰德的愿景将“大学、政府和行业为基础的科学技术世界；纽约和旧金山的艺术界；旧金山湾区的迷幻社区；以及 20 世纪 60 年代在美国各地兴起的公社”结合在一起。5在这里，个人感知的大门可以通过 LSD 或个人电子产品打开。这种混合的异质性在布兰德著名的《全球概览》反主流文化圣经中的任何一页中都有所体现。目录的任何一页都可能有一件受美洲原住民启发的鹿皮衬衫、一本心理学书籍和一台微型计算机。特纳认为，布兰德的社群主义不仅仅关乎土地和新的田园愿景；它还包含“小规模技术可以改变个人意识，进而改变社区本质的理念。” 6布兰德关于个人技术和个人意识提升的新社群主义理论后来在 20 世纪 90 年代赛博自由主义的互联网思想中得到体现，并最终催生了《连线》杂志和在线讨论论坛，例如 Whole Earth 'Lectronic Link 或 WELL。

First, communication scholar Fred Turner’s excellent profile of Stewart Brand in From Counterculture to Cyberculture illustrates the turn to personal, liberatory technologies.4 Brand was a quintessential New Communalist, a leader of the back-to-the-land movement of the 1960s. While “back to the land” implies a renewed pastoralism, Brand’s vision brought together “the world of university-, government-, and industry-based science and technology; the New York and San Francisco art scenes; the Bay area psychedelic community; and the communes that sprang up across America in the 1960s.”5 Here, the doors of individual perception could be opened up through LSD or through personal electronics. The heterogeneity of such a mix is illustrated by any given page of Brand’s famous Whole Earth Catalog counterculture bible. Any given page of the catalog might have a Native American-inspired buckskin shirt, a book on psychology, and a microcomputer. As Turner argues, Brand’s communalism was not just about the land and a new pastoral vision; it embraced “the notion that small-scale technologies could transform the individual conscious and, with it, the nature of community.”6 Brand’s New Communalist theory of individual technologies and individual consciousness-raising would later find a home in 1990s cyberlibertarian thinking about the internet, culminating in the birth of Wired magazine and online discussion forums such as the Whole Earth ‘Lectronic Link or WELL.

除了 20 世纪中后期布兰德的新社群主义，我们还看到自助治疗文化的个人尺度技术的兴起。这种文化包括旨在帮助个人克服潜意识冲突的精神分析和精神病学技术。但 20 世纪 70 年代的治疗文化不仅仅是训练有素的心理学专家帮助个人；它也体现在广受欢迎的自助文本中。因此，治疗的技术专长受到美国文化和消费主义的粗犷个人主义的影响：“[弗洛伊德] 心理治疗的语言离开了专家的领域，转向了它与美国文化的其他各种关键类别相互交织、融合，例如追求幸福、自力更生、相信自我完美。” 7

Alongside the New Communalism of Brand in the mid- to late twentieth century, we also see a rise in individual-scale techniques of self-help therapy culture. This culture included psychoanalytic and psychiatric techniques aimed to help individuals overcome subconscious conflicts. But the therapeutic culture of the 1970s was not purely about trained psychological experts aiding individuals; it also found expression in wildly popular self-help texts. Thus, the technical expertise of therapy was mediated by the rugged individualism of American culture and consumerism: “the language of [Freudian] psychotherapy left the realm of experts and moved to the realm of popular culture, where it interlocked and combined with various other key categories of American culture, such as the pursuit of happiness, self-reliance, and the belief in the perfectibility of the self.”7

20 世纪 70 年代出现了一种个性化的治疗领域，称为神经语言程序设计 (NLP)。NLP 由治疗师理查德·班德勒 (Richard Bandler) 和约翰·格林德 (John Grinder) 开发，是一种涉及催眠和暗示的治疗技术，旨在帮助患者缓解恐惧症和克服心理问题。8顾名思义，NLP 从业者认为，患者可以通过暗示和与其他更积极的记忆的联系来修改他们对过去经历的记忆，从而对其进行重新编程。“NLP 是按照上升技术铸造的：语言是一种编程神经机器的方式。” 9最重要的是，NLP 认为个人——而不是更广泛的社会结构——应对自己的恐惧症、恐惧和问题负全部责任。重新编程自我比解决社会弊病更重要。10班德勒和格林德 1979 年出版的《青蛙变王子》一书让人们能够研究并将这种上升技术应用到自己的生活中。11自我完善与大众社会工程师所设想的社会规模操纵相去甚远。（顺便说一句，NLP 在黑客社会工程师中颇具影响力；我们将在第 6 章“渗透”中再次讨论 NLP。）

One such individualized field of therapy that arose in the 1970s was called neuro-linguistic programming (NLP). Developed by the therapists Richard Bandler and John Grinder, NLP is a therapeutic technique that involves hypnosis and suggestion in order to help patients alleviate phobias and overcome psychological problems.8 Like its name implies, NLP practitioners argue that a patient can be reprogrammed by having their memories of past experiences modified through suggestions and connections to other, more positive memories. “NLP was cast in the mold of ascendant technology: language was a way of programming the neural machine.”9 Above all, NLP holds that the individual—not broader social structures—is fully responsible for their own phobias, fears, and problems. Reprogramming the self takes precedence over tackling social ills.10 Bandler and Grinder’s 1979 book Frogs into Princes allowed individuals to study and apply this ascendant technology to their own lives.11 Self-improvement is a far cry from the societal-scale manipulation envisioned by mass social engineers. (Incidentally, NLP was quite influential among hacker social engineers; we will return to NLP in chapter 6, “Penetrating.”)

个性化的自助和治疗技术影响了一种新的个性化自助政治形式。12一本关键的文本是马克·萨廷的《新时代政治》，写于 1976 年，1979 年商业出版。《新时代政治》呼应了对大规模社会工程的恐惧，谴责“‘铁板一块的机构’，或拥有极权控制权力的机构：交通、医疗、学校、宗教、核心家庭、核能、国防系统、铁板一块的国家、统治精英等等。” 13萨廷用“个人责任、自力更生、自由选择、信仰道德价值观和理想，以及对我们中的一些人选择称之为上帝的无所不包的爱。” 14在这里，由技术精英推动的政治被自我意识的治疗政治所取代。

The individualized techniques of self-help and therapy influenced a new form of individualized, self-help politics.12 A key text is Mark Satin’s book New Age Politics, written in 1976 and published commercially in 1979. New Age Politics echoes the fears of mass social engineering, condemning “‘monolithic institutions,’ or institutions with totalizing, controlling power: transportation, medicine, schooling, religion, the nuclear family, nuclear power, the defense system, the monolithic state, the governing elite, and so on.”13 Satin counters the monolithic with “personal responsibility, self-reliance, freedom of choice, belief in ethical values and ideals, and an all-encompassing love for what some of us choose to call God.”14 Here, a politics driven by technocratic elites is replaced by the therapeutic politics of self-consciousness.

至于经济学，我们也可以指出 20 世纪 70 年代新自由主义的兴起，这是有据可查的。15 新自由主义是对亚当·斯密 1776 年论文《国富论》中经济自由主义的回归，该论文提出社会是由理性个人的总体市场行为中出现的“看不见的手”引导的。16经济学中这种对个人主义的回归否定了政府对经济的强有力监管——更不用说任何暗示社会主义的东西了——而主张将所有人类行为归结为自由市场中个人的理性选择。新自由主义在主流经济学派中都有立足之地，尤其是芝加哥大学的米尔顿·弗里德曼，以及弗吉尼亚州的戈登·塔洛克和詹姆斯·布坎南等学派，以及反主流文化运动，如无政府主义。17

As for economics, we can also point to the well-documented rise of neoliberalism in the 1970s.15 Neoliberalism was a return to the economic liberalism of Adam Smith’s 1776 treatise The Wealth of Nations, which proposed that society is directed by an “invisible hand” that emerges from the aggregated, market actions of rational individuals.16 This return to individualism in economics repudiated strong governmental regulations of the economy—not to mention anything that hinted of socialism—in favor of a reduction of all human action to individual, rational choices in a free marketplace. Neoliberalism found homes both in the mainstream schools of economics, notably at the University of Chicago’s Milton Friedman and to a lesser extent schools in Virginia with Gordon Tullock and James Buchanan, as well as countercultural movements such as Agorism.17

这一历史背景——20 世纪 70 年代个人主义的兴起——与我们对​​社会工程学的兴趣有两个方面相关。首先，个人主义的兴起使人们对 20 世纪 20 年代至 50 年代盛行的大规模社会工程学的批判深入人心。社会科学家理论化并由精英、技术官僚的大规模社会工程师实施的全社会解决方案被淘汰了。个人规模的技术和技术、自助治疗思维和政治以及一对一经济交换的解放则成为主流。

This historical context—the rise of individualism in the 1970s—has two aspects relevant to our interest in social engineering. First, the rise of the individual hammered home the critiques of mass social engineering prevalent from the 1920s through 1950s. Society-wide solutions, theorized by social scientists and implemented by elite, technocratic mass social engineers, were out. Individual-scale technologies and techniques, self-help therapeutic thinking and politics, and the liberation of one-to-one economic exchange, were in.

其次，在这种环境下，社会工程学再次兴起，尽管形式与旧有的大众形式截然不同。20 世纪 70 年代中期，一群自称“电话飞客”的人开始在电话中谈论他们自己的社会工程学版本。18

Second, within this milieu, social engineering arose again, albeit in a very different form from the older mass form. Sometime in the mid-1970s, a group of people who called themselves “phone phreaks” started talking on the telephone about their own version of social engineering.18

电话飞客

The Phone Phreaks

1971 年，一位记者写道：“20 世纪 60 年代中期，贝尔电话公司

“In the mid [1960s],” writes a journalist in 1971, the Bell Telephone company,

以及世界上几乎所有其他电话公司，决定将价值数十亿美元的电话设备转换为基于 12 个音调的兼容系统。从那时起，一群对电子电路着迷的大学生、满脸雀斑的青少年和听力敏锐的盲童一直紧跟最新的电话技术。他们称自己为“电话迷” 。19

and almost every other phone company in the world, decided to convert billions of dollars of telephone equipment to a compatible system based on 12 tones. Ever since, groups of college students high on electronic circuitry, freckle-faced teen-agers and blind kids with sensitive hearing have kept up with the latest telephone technology. They call themselves “phone freaks.”19

电话飞客（最好是两个电话）深深迷恋贝尔电话系统。正如旧 AT&T 广告所说，电话网络包括“一个政策、一个系统和普遍服务”——一个庞大的、横跨大陆的、垄断的技术系统，而电话飞客想要探索这一切。20

The phone phreaks (two ph’s are preferred) were deeply enamored with the Bell Telephone system. The phone network encompassed, as the old AT&T advertisements put it, “one policy, one system, and universal service”—a massive, continent-spanning, monopolized technological system, and the phreaks wanted to explore it all.20

美国各地都有电话飞客，其中包括一群有趣的人物，其中许多人将出现在本书的后续页面中：约翰“Cap'n Crunch”德雷珀，一名受过空军训练的电气工程师；丹尼·特雷西，一名来自加利福尼亚的盲人少年；苏珊“Thunder”海德利，一名摇滚追星族、性工作者和钱币收藏家；凯文·米特尼克，他在 20 世纪 90 年代臭名昭著地领导联邦调查局进行追捕；约翰“Corrupt”李，一个纽约市的黑人孩子，他在街头帮派和著名私立高中之间分配时间；以及乔丹哈宾格，一个手机飞客，后来成为一名把妹达人。

Phone phreaks were found all over the United States and include a cast of colorful characters, many of whom will appear in the subsequent pages of this book: John “Cap’n Crunch” Draper, an Air Force-trained electrical engineer; Denny Teresi, a blind teenager from California; Susan “Thunder” Headley, a rock groupie, sex worker, and coin collector; Kevin Mitnick, who would infamously lead the FBI on a manhunt in the 1990s; John “Corrupt” Lee, a Black kid in New York City who split his time between a street gang and a prestigious private high school; and Jordan Harbinger, a cell phone phreak who would later become a pickup artist.

正如历史学家和技术企业家 Phil Lapsley 在他的著作《电话爆炸》中所说，电话飞客对探索电话网络的痴迷要求他们要么支付高额的长途电话费，要么想方设法逃避支付。21他们经常选择后者，因此电话公司和各政府机构将电话飞客视为欺诈者。但正如电话飞客经常强调的那样，他们不仅仅是在欺骗系统。他们有强烈的愿望相互联系，了解贝尔系统最广泛的知识，当然，也希望得到同行的认可。虽然史蒂夫·沃兹尼亚克最出名的身份是苹果电脑的联合创始人，但他也是一名电话飞客。正如他在《手机爆炸》的前言中指出的那样，

As historian and technology entrepreneur Phil Lapsley argues in his book Exploding the Phone, the phreaks’ obsession with exploring the phone network required that they either pay hefty long-distance phone bills or find ways to avoid paying.21 They often chose the latter, and thus the phreaks were vilified as fraudsters by the phone company and various government agencies. But as the phreaks often emphasized, they weren’t simply scamming the system. They had an intense desire to connect with one another, to gain knowledge of the furthest reaches of the Bell system, and, of course, to be recognized by their peers for this knowledge. While Steve Wozniak is best known as a co-founder of Apple Computers, he was also a phone phreak. As he notes in his forward to Exploding the Phone,

对我来说，电话盗打是世界上一个我像领导者一样的地方。这是一个我可以大展宏图的地方。这并不是说我可以成为一名罪犯——并不是因为我们有很多人要打电话，或者有巨额电话费，或者真的想欺骗电话公司或诸如此类。只是它太令人兴奋了！当我走进一个房间，用一个蓝色的盒子展示电话技巧时，我就像一个在玩魔术的魔术师。我是关注的焦点。这也许是我前进的部分动力。但这也是做一些没人相信可能的事情的魅力所在。

for me, phone phreaking was a place in the world that I was like a leader. It was a place where I could blossom. And it’s not that I could blossom as a criminal—it wasn’t that we had lots of people to call or had giant phone bills or really wanted to rip off the phone company or anything. It’s just that it was so exciting! When I went into a room and showed off phone tricks with a blue box, I was like a magician playing tricks. I was the center of attention. That was probably partly what drove me. But it was also the fascination of doing something that nobody would really believe was possible.

正如苏西·“雷霆”·海德利 1983 年在美国参议院作证时所说，当网络飞客聚在一起时，“每个人都想胜过其他人，看看谁更厉害，谁更优秀，谁有更好的访问权限，谁能进入最严密或最好的系统。” 22

And as Susy “Thunder” Headley put it in her testimony to the US Senate in 1983, when phreaks got together, “everybody was trying to outdo everybody else to see who was greater, who was better, who had better access, who could get into the tightest or best systems.”22

因此，对于许多电话飞客来说，免费拨打长途电话是实现更大目标的一种手段：看看电话能带你去哪里，了解电话是如何连接的，看看你是否可以通过一次通话联系到多个人，或者只是听听世界各地交换设备的各种声音——并向其他人炫耀你的壮举。23拉普斯利的《电话爆炸》将贝尔电话系统描述为“巨大的网络机械人系统……世界上最大的机器。” 24对于电话飞客来说，贝尔系统是一个技术游乐场。他们探索它的能力为他们带来了社会资本和在社交圈中的影响力。

Thus, for many phreaks, getting free long-distance calls was a means to a larger end: to see where the phone can take you, to understand how its connections are made, to find out if you can connect multiple people on a single call, or simply to hear the various sounds of switching equipment around the world—and to show off your feats to others.23 Lapsley’s Exploding the Phone describes the Bell Telephone system as a “giant cyber-mechanical-human system . . . , the largest machine in the world.”24 For the phreaks, the Bell System was a technological playland. Their ability to explore it gave them social capital and influence among their social circles.

电话飞客是黑客的雏形，他们利用电话技术来研究如何利用这些技术。事实上，大多数黑客历史都表明，电话飞客直接导致了计算机黑客攻击。25当我们研究电话飞客时，这并不奇怪出版物。早期的杂志，例如20 世纪 70 和 80 年代的Telephone Electronics Line和TAP，主要致力于电话系统。紧随其后的出版物2600建立在它们的基础上 - 事实上，“2600”这个名字是指电话控制音的频率（以赫兹为单位）。但是2600于 1984 年创刊，至今仍在印刷，它的重点从电话盗用转变为计算机黑客。这种关注点的转变也可以从这段历史上的一些关键人物身上看到 - Susan Headley、Lewis De Payne 和 Kevin Mitnick 在 20 世纪 70 年代和 80 年代都自认为是电话盗用者，但最终在 20 世纪 90 年代重新认定为黑客。此外，许多电话飞客在 20 世纪 80 年代的计算机公告板系统 (BBS) 上分享他们的技术知识，这种做法需要电话、计算机和网络方面的知识。

Phone phreaks were proto-hackers, playing with phone technologies to see what could be done with them. Indeed, most histories of hacking find that phreaking led directly to computer hacking.25 This is not surprising when we look at phone phreak publications. Early magazines, such as Telephone Electronics Line and TAP in the 1970s and 1980s, were largely dedicated to the phone system. A publication that followed on their heels, 2600, built on their foundation—in fact, the name “2600” refers to the frequency in Hertz of a telephone control tone. But 2600, which launched in 1984 and is still in print to this day, transitioned from focusing on phone phreaking to computer hacking. This transition in focus can also be seen in some of the key figures in this history—Susan Headley, Lewis De Payne, and Kevin Mitnick all self-identified as phone phreaks in the 1970s and ’80s but eventually reidentified as hackers by the 1990s. Moreover, many phone phreaks shared their knowledge of their craft on 1980s-era computer bulletin board systems (BBSs), a practice that required knowledge of phones, computers, and networking.

电话飞客和他们的黑客后代当然培养了技术知识，并掌握了各自目标系统的技术。他们开发了个人解放技术，例如可以产生电话控制音的蓝盒子，或可以模仿硬币叮当响声的红盒子。他们的黑客后代将个人电脑视为解放技术。他们还模仿了一些反主流文化的语言，认为电话和电脑是通往新网络世界的窗口。他们经常用自助的术语来描述他们的活动，声称寻求知识来提高他们的技能。他们与新自由主义者一样厌恶电话公司，直到里根政府执政之前，电话公司一直是国家批准的垄断企业。正如 Headley 所说，“电话公司是一个怪物，几年前就应该被消灭。” 26

Phone phreaks and their hacker offspring certainly cultivated technical knowledge and technological mastery of their respective target systems. They developed personal liberation technologies, such as Blue Boxes that could create telephone control tones, or Red Boxes that could imitate the sounds of coins clinking into payphone slots. Their hacker offspring celebrated the personal computer as a liberation technology. They also aped some of the language of the counterculture, thinking of phones and computers as windows into new cyberworlds. They often described their activities in self-help terms, claiming to seek knowledge to improve their skills. And they shared some of the distaste of the neoliberals with the phone company, which was a state-sanctioned monopoly up until the Reagan administration. As Headley put it, “the phone company is a monster that should have been killed years ago.”26

他们也有社交的一面。这可能出现在长达数小时（甚至数天）的“电话会议”中，或通过互联网中继聊天或 BBS 进行激烈的在线社交中。或者，它会出现在他们的聚会上，在那里他们聚在一起谈论电话或电脑。但对我们来说最重要的是，飞客和黑客的社交性也出现了他们从 20 世纪 70 年代中期开始使用这个术语，称之为“社会工程学”。

They had a social side, as well. This might appear in hours-long (or even days-long) “conference calls” or in intense online socializing over Internet Relay Chat or BBSs. Or it would appear in conventions where they get together to talk about telephones or computers. But most importantly for us, phreak and hacker sociality also appeared in what they called “social engineering,” a term they started using in the mid-1970s.

通过社会工程手段进行电话诈骗和黑客攻击

Phreaking and Hacking via Social Engineering

电话飞客社会工程学本质上非常简单。与使用诸如蓝盒子之类的技术来控制网络相比，电话飞客通常更容易打电话给电话接线员并简单地要求访问网络的受限部分。正如一名电话飞客在 1973 年解释的那样，“一些最好的电话飞客根本不使用任何硬件。你可以说服电话公司的人为你做事。” 27电话飞客社会工程师可能会借口他们是需要服务的客户，或者更常见的借口是需要访问特殊技术测试线路或容量的同事。纪录片《黑客秘史》重现了其中一次交锋。在这个重现中，电话飞客丹尼斯·特里提供了一段典型的对话：“你好吗？很好，伙计！我是亚利桑那州凤凰城阿尔卑斯办公室的鲍勃。我们需要运行一个测试，一个传输测试……” 28这种友好的玩笑——加上电话公司的行话——会诱使电信公司的员工相信他们正在与同事交谈。访问权限很快就会被授予。获得访问权限后，飞客就可以拨打长途电话或与其他飞客建立电话会议。这些做法延续到了计算机安全黑客的世界：通常，打电话或发电子邮件给某人并询问密码比破解加密更容易。

Phone phreak social engineering is, at its core, very simple. Rather than using a piece of technology such as a Blue Box to control the network, often it was easier for a phreak to call up a telephone operator and simply ask for access to restricted parts of the network. As one phreak explained in 1973, “some of the best phone phreaks don’t use any hardware at all. You can talk people in the telephone company into doing stuff for you.”27 A phreak social engineer might use the pretext that they are a customer in need of a service, or more often the pretext of being a fellow employee in need of access to special technical test lines or capacities. The documentary The Secret History of Hacking recreates one of these engagements. In this recreation, phone phreak Dennis Terry offers a typical conversation: “How ya doin’? Good, buddy! This is Bob from the Alpine Office in Phoenix, Arizona. We have a test that we’re needing to run, a transmission test . . .”28 This friendly banter—coupled with phone company lingo—tricks the telco employee into believing they are talking to a fellow employee. Access is soon granted. After they get access, the phreak can then make their long-distance calls or set up conference calls with fellow phreaks. These practices carry forward into the world of computer security hacking: often, it’s easier to just call or email someone and just ask for a password than it is to break through encryption.

但为什么要把听起来像骗术的东西称为“工程”呢？为什么要用这么一个受人尊敬的词来形容这种诡计呢？大众社会工程师采用这个术语来调用一种从科学到实施的模型，并模仿 19 世纪和 20 世纪土木工程的成功。相比之下，飞客开玩笑。事实上，他们用来欺骗电话接线员的更常见的术语似乎更诚实：“胡说八道”。一位名叫“导师”的黑客总结了这两个术语之间的关系：“对于那些可能刚接触的人来说，‘工程’是‘社会工程’的缩写，而‘社会工程’是‘胡说八道’的缩写。” 29

But why call something that sounds like con artistry “engineering”? Why use such a respectable word for such trickery? The mass social engineers took up the term to invoke a science-to-implementation model and emulate the triumphs of nineteenth- and twentieth-century civil engineering. In contrast, phreaks were making a joke. Indeed, a more common term they used for conning a telephone operator seems far more honest: “bullshitting.” A hacker called The Mentor sums up the relationship between the terms: “For those of you who may be new, ‘engineering’ is short for ‘social engineering,’ which is long for ‘bullshitting.’”29

但最终，“社会工程”成为了这种黑客行为的名称。黑客文献中没有任何内容可以解释为什么“社会工程”一词会占据主导地位。然而，考虑到这些电话飞客对庞大的电话系统感兴趣——这是一项电气工程壮举——并且他们的队伍中包括像约翰“Cap'n Crunch”德雷珀这样训练有素的电气工程师，将操纵人视为一个工程过程的玩笑想法是有道理的。随着 20 世纪 80 年代电话飞客转变为计算机黑客，这个术语一直沿用至今。

But eventually, “social engineering” takes over as the name of this hacker practice. There’s nothing in the hacker literature that explains why the term “social engineering” came to predominate. However, given that the phreaks were interested in the vast telephone system—a feat of electrical engineering—and given that they included in their ranks trained electrical engineers like John “Cap’n Crunch” Draper, the playful idea that manipulating people was an engineering process makes sense. This term carried on as phreaking transitioned to computer hacking in the 1980s.

此外，这些电话窃贼还意外发现了“engineering”一词一个奇怪的词源特征：它的词根是gin。从这个词根，我们得到了“ingenuity”一词以及相关词“engineer”和“engineering”，指的是操纵环境的能力。我们还得到了一个过时但颇具启发性的含义：牛津英语词典将gin定义为“圈套、网、陷阱”。30其中包括言语陷阱。事实上，在英语历史上的许多用法中，“engine”实际上较少指物理技术，而更多指恶棍的操纵阴谋和诡计，最终在埃德蒙·斯宾塞的 16 世纪史诗《仙后》中出现了一个名为“Malengin”的恶棍角色。31事实证明，Malengin 非常擅长用语言操纵他人。32如果斯宾塞在 20 世纪 70 年代写作，马伦金很可能已经在电话飞客中茁壮成长了。

Moreover, the phreaks accidentally hit on a curious etymological feature of the word “engineering”: its root is gin. From that root we get the term “ingenuity” and its related words “engine” and “engineering,” which refers to the capacity to manipulate one’s environment. We also get an obsolete—yet quite illuminating—meaning: gin is defined in the Oxford English Dictionary as “a snare, net, trap.”30 This included verbal traps. Indeed, in many uses in English history, “engine” actually referred less to physical technologies and more to the manipulative machinations and tricks of villains, culminating in a villainous character called “Malengin” in Edmund Spenser’s epic sixteenth-century poem The Faerie Queene.31 Malengin, it turns out, is quite adept at manipulating people with his use of language.32 Had Spenser been writing in the 1970s, Malengin would probably have thrived among the phone phreaks.

尽管自 20 世纪 70 年代以来，技术发生了数十年的变化，但这种人际黑客形式的社会工程学至今仍然存在。固定电话让位于无线电话；简单的密码让位于双因素身份验证和强加密。尽管发生了这些变化，但仅仅诱骗某人放弃对网络或资源的访问仍然有效。我们可能会认为黑客是穿着连帽衫的孤独者，弯腰驼背地坐在发光的键盘前，疯狂地打字以破解加密。我们可能会认为他们是反社会的，就像他们无法理解计算机网络一样无法理解人类。然而，黑客的社会工程实践表明，他们非常善于与他人打交道。虽然我们可能认为技术攻击是破坏计算机网络的主要途径，但事实证明，社会工程——人际网络和陷阱——非常常见，而且非常有效。网络安全领域的一份重要年度报告《威瑞森数据泄露调查报告》一贯将社交攻击列为黑客进入受限网络的最常见和最危险的途径。33正如社会工程师凯文·米特尼克 (Kevin Mitnick) 喜欢说的那样，在信息安全领域，“人是最薄弱的环节” 。34

Although technologies have changed over the decades since the 1970s, this interpersonal hacker form of social engineering is still with us today. Landline phones gave way to wireless telephony; simple passwords gave way to two-factor authentication and strong encryption. Despite these changes, simply tricking someone into giving up access to a network or resource remains effective. We might think of hackers as hoodie-clad loners hunched over glowing keyboards, furiously typing away to break through encryption. We may think of them as anti-social, just as incapable of understanding humans as they are capable of understanding computer networks. The hacker practice of social engineering, however, reveals that they are quite capable of relating to others. And while we may think of technical attacks as the key vector by which computer networks are compromised, it turns out that social engineering—gins, interpersonal nets and traps—is very common and extremely effective. A key annual report in the cybersecurity world, the Verizon Data Breach Investigations Report, consistently lists social attacks as the most common and dangerous vector by which hackers gain access to restricted networks.33 As the social engineer Kevin Mitnick is fond of saying, in information security, “the human is the weakest link.”34

黑客社会工程学作为人际沟通

Hacker Social Engineering as Interpersonal Communication

电话飞客和后来的黑客通过人际沟通渠道开展工作。当然，电话飞客首选的媒介是电话。正如历史学家克劳德·费舍尔 (Claude Fischer) 所解释的那样，早期的电话是一种寻求用途的发明。最初，电话公司试图将其用作另一种广播媒介，传输“新闻、音乐会、教堂服务和天气预报”。35然而，到 20 世纪 30 年代，电话用户自己最终将其转变为一种社交媒介。36一对对的人或共用线路上的小团体通过电话建立和维持亲密关系。到了 20 世纪 50 年代，电话被认为是这种亲密关系的媒介。正如贝尔工程师 AB Clark 在 1952 年所写的那样，“电话联系的价值不能用说的话的数量来衡量，因为它将人们联系在一起如此一来，双方就能以非常亲密的方式达成谅解，就像直接会面一样。” 37

Phreaks, and the later hackers, did their work through interpersonal communication channels. The phreaks’ preferred medium, of course, was the telephone. As historian Claude Fischer explains, early telephony was an invention seeking a use. Initially, telephone companies tried using it as another broadcast medium, transmitting “news, concerts, church services, [and] weather reports.”35 Eventually, however, telephone users themselves transformed it into a medium for sociality by the 1930s.36 Pairs of people, or small groups on party lines, built and maintained intimate relationships over the phone. By the 1950s, the telephone was understood to be a medium for such intimacies. As Bell engineer A. B. Clark writes in 1952, “The value of a connection by telephone cannot be measured by the number of words spoken for it brings people together in great intimacy so that understandings can be reached almost as well as in a direct meeting.”37

电话飞客和其他人一样，他们通过电话建立关系。由于电话飞客遍布全国——事实上，遍布世界各地——他们必须找到一种无需支付昂贵长途电话费就能相互交谈的方法。他们使用社交工程，部分是为了实现人际交流。他们的社交互动，部分帮助他们练习人际沟通技巧，使他们能够更有效地对电话公司员工进行社交工程。

The phone phreaks were like anyone else; they built relationships over the phone. Since phreaks were all over the country—indeed, all over the world—they had to find a way to talk to one another without paying expensive long-distance bills. They used social engineering, in part, to enable their interpersonal communication. And their social interactions, in part, helped them practice the interpersonal communication skills that enabled them to more effectively social engineer telephone company employees.

电话飞客社会工程学的人际方面已经延伸到其他领域。当代黑客社会工程师使用电子邮件或短信，这两种媒介被人际沟通学者认为对建立人际关系很有用。38当社会工程师对组织进行“物理渗透”时，他们甚至会面对面地开展工作——这是人际沟通的黄金标准。他们亲自前往目标组织，说服员工允许他们进入禁区。

The interpersonal aspects of phone phreak social engineering have translated into other areas. Contemporary, hacker social engineers use email or texting, two other media that interpersonal communication scholars recognize as useful for building interpersonal relationships.38 Social engineers even do their work face to face—the gold standard of interpersonal communication—when they do “physical penetration” of organizations. They go in person to targeted organizations and persuade employees to give them access to restricted areas.

因此，20 世纪早期社会工程形式与 20 世纪 70 年代电话飞客形式的社会工程形式之间的一个主要区别在于目标：群体与个人。

Thus, one major contrast between the early twentieth-century form and the 1970s phone phreak form of social engineering hinges on the target: the crowd versus the individual.

关联大众和人际社会工程

Relating Mass and Interpersonal Social Engineering

到目前为止，我们已经阐明了社会工程学的两个不同含义：大众形式，它是在 20 世纪初发展起来的，在李、伯内斯和弗莱施曼的“同意工程”中得到了最充分的体现；另一种是电话飞客用来欺骗电话接线员让他们访问电话系统受限部分的俏皮的人际形式。

So far, we have illuminated two distinct meanings of social engineering: the mass form, which was developed in the early twentieth century and found its greatest expression in the “consent engineering” of Lee, Bernays, and Fleischman, and a playful, interpersonal form used by phone phreaks to con telephone operators into giving them access to restricted parts of the telephone system.

如果飞客和黑客正在做的是“社会工程”，那么它似乎与更早的大规模形式没有什么关系。然而，正如美国海军学院教授约瑟夫·哈特菲尔德所说，这两种做法在语义和实践上有许多重叠之处：都依赖于他所谓的知识不对称、技术统治和目的论替代。简而言之，这些术语意味着所有社会工程师都隐藏他们的真实目的，利用社会技术知识来控制他人，并试图操纵他人去做他们通常不一定会做的事情。39

If what the phreaks and hackers are doing is “social engineering,” it appears to have little relation to the older, mass form. However, as US Naval Academy professor Joseph Hatfield argues, the two practices share many semantic and practical overlaps: both rely upon what he calls epistemic asymmetry, technocratic dominance, and teleological replacement. Put simply, these terms mean that all social engineers hide their true purposes, use sociotechnical knowledge to control others, and seek to manipulate others into doing things they may not necessarily normally do.39

当我们查看这些术语的当代定义时，我们可以看到这两种社会工程学形式之间存在更多重叠。首先是来自政治理论家的所谓大规模社会工程学的定义：

We can see further overlaps between the two forms of social engineering when we look at contemporary definitions of the terms. First is a definition of what we would call mass social engineering, coming from political theorists:

社会工程意味着安排和引导环境和社会力量，以创造发生有效社会行动的高概率。工程一词意味着设计和建立以人类为原材料的结构和流程。40

Social engineering means arranging and channeling environmental and social forces to create a high probability that effective social action would occur. The word engineering suggests the designing and erecting of structures and processes in which human beings serve as raw material.40

安全顾问 Chris Hadnagy 对人际黑客形式的社会工程学给出了定义：“社会工程学是指影响一个人采取可能符合也可能不符合其最佳利益的行动的任何行为。” 41对于 Hadnagy 来说，这通常意味着说服人们泄露密码、授予其访问受限信息系统的权限或泄露私人或专有信息。

And here is a definition of the interpersonal hacker form of social engineering from security consultant Chris Hadnagy: “Social engineering is any act that influences a person to take an action that may or may not be in his or her best interests.”41 For Hadnagy, this typically means convincing people to give out their passwords, give access to restricted information systems, or reveal private or proprietary information.

我们认为，这两个定义都关注人类在复杂的社会技术系统中的地位。对于 20 世纪早期至中期的大众社会工程师来说，人类社会可以通过社会科学来了解，而这些知识可以用来传达大众传播信息，从而指导和塑造社会。虽然传统的工程领域带来了令人印象深刻的新卫生设施、交通运输，和通信基础设施，但人类世界仍然混乱不堪，需要社会控制来最大限度地发挥现代化的优势，充分利用技术成果。对于 20 世纪 70 年代以来的人际黑客社会工程师来说，与技术互动的个人可以被说服信任黑客，并向黑客提供访问受限信息的权限。黑客可能只是对探索系统感兴趣。或者，黑客可能有犯罪意图。无论哪种方式，系统的人类操作员都是进入系统的障碍，因此必须说服他们向黑客提供访问权限。借用米特尼克的话来说，对于这两种类型的社会工程学来说，人类都是“薄弱环节”，是需要操纵的原材料，以实现社会工程师想要的结果。

Both definitions, we suggest, share a concern with the place of humans within complex sociotechnical systems. For the mass social engineers of the early to mid-twentieth century, human society could be known through social science, and that knowledge could be used to inform mass communication messages that would direct and shape society. While traditional fields of engineering had brought about impressive new sanitation, transportation, and communication infrastructures, the world of humans was still messy and in need of social control to maximize the benefits of modernity and take full advantage of the fruits of technologists. For the interpersonal hacker social engineers of the 1970s onward, individual humans who interact with technologies could be convinced to trust the hacker and provide the hacker access to restricted information. A hacker might be merely interested in exploring a system. Or, the hacker might have criminal intentions. Either way, the human operator of the system was a barrier to entry to it, and thus had to be persuaded to give the hacker access. To riff on Mitnick, for both types of social engineering, humans are a “weak link,” a raw material in need of manipulation in order to achieve what the social engineer wants.

事实上，在控制“薄弱环节”方面，大众社会工程和人际黑客社会工程都热爱专业知识和精英主义，并鄙视他们的目标。当尤恩采访伯内斯时，伯内斯毫不避讳地宣称需要“少数聪明人”通过他们卓越的知识来控制不幸的大众。42黑客社会工程师在评估他们的目标时甚至会更加直言不讳。在 1994 年 HOPE 会议的一次小组讨论中， 2600黑客杂志的出版商E​​mmanuel Goldstein 打趣说，社会工程“与计算机黑客非常相似，只是另一端的人并不像计算机那么聪明。”观众听了这句话开怀大笑。43这两种社会工程都重视技术知识，并经常将目标视为倒霉的乡巴佬，这表明了哈特菲尔德所说的“知识不对称”和“技术统治” 。44

Indeed, when it comes to controlling the “weak link,” both mass social engineering and interpersonal hacker social engineering share a love of expertise and elitism and a disdain for their targets. When Ewen interviewed Bernays, Bernays was not shy about proclaiming a need for an “intelligent few” to control the hapless masses through their superior knowledge.42 Hacker social engineers can be even more blunt in their assessment of their targets. In a panel discussion at the 1994 HOPE conference, the publisher of the 2600 hacker magazine Emmanuel Goldstein quipped that social engineering “is amazingly like computer hacking, except the people at the other end aren’t quite as intelligent as computers.” The audience laughed heartily at that line.43 Both variations of social engineering value technical knowledge and often see their targets as hapless rubes, demonstrating what Hatfield calls “epistemic asymmetry” and “technocratic dominance.”44

这种对技术和技巧的共同热爱导致了在社会技术系统中对人类进行系统化工程的方法。受到土木工程的启发，大众社会工程师在很大程度上将这种理性方法视为理所当然。正如我们将在第 6 章“渗透”中探讨的那样，黑客形式的人际社会就像之前的大众社会工程一样，人际社会工程最终也会借鉴社会科学。虽然网络飞客和黑客最初是利用直觉和才能来操纵目标，但到了 2000 年代后期，专业的社会工程师会开发出一套理论文献，主要从进化心理学中提炼出来，以系统化他们的实践。从这个意义上讲，人际社会工程呼应了早期大众社会工程从科学到实施的概念，进一步巩固了他们的技术统治地位。

This shared love of the technical and of technique results in a systematized approach to engineering humans within sociotechnical systems. Inspired by civil engineering, the mass social engineers took this rational approach largely as a given. As we will explore in chapter 6, “Penetrating,” the hacker form of interpersonal social engineering would also eventually draw on social science, just as the previous mass form did. While the phreaks and hackers initially started out using intuition and talent to manipulate their targets, by the late 2000s, professional social engineers would develop a theoretical literature, largely culled from evolutionary psychology, to systematize their practices. In this sense, interpersonal social engineering echoes the earlier mass social engineering conception of science-to-implementation, furthering their technocratic dominance.

这就引出了本书的一个主要关注点：关注并理论化社会工程学的广泛、系统化过程。回想一下 Doris Flesichman 提出的“同意工程”的过程，我们在上一章中讨论过：获取事实、研究公众、辨别影响他们的心理方式并与他们沟通。这种研究、场景构建和参与的基本模式也出现在当代专业化的社会工程学文献中。例如，安全顾问 Sharon Conheady 的《IT 安全中的社会工程学》一书的核心章节是“研究和侦察”、“创建场景”、“执行社会工程测试”和“撰写社会工程报告”。Conheady 的这本书出版于 2014 年，系统化了自 1970 年代以来飞客和黑客一直在做的事情。45

This brings us to a major concern of this book: a focus on, and theorization of, the broad, systematized process of social engineering writ large. Recall the processes of “consent engineering” Doris Flesichman suggested, discussed in the previous chapter: get the facts, study the public, discern psychological ways to influence them, and communicate with them. This basic pattern of research, scenario construction, and engagement also appears in the contemporary, professionalized social engineering literature. For example, the core chapters of security consultant Sharon Conheady’s book Social Engineering in IT Security, are “Research and reconnaissance,” “Creating the scenario,” “Executing the social engineering test,” and “Writing the social engineering report.” Published in 2014, Conheady’s book systematized what the phreaks and hackers had been doing since the 1970s.45

事实上，正如我们在书中更详细探讨的那样，20 世纪 70 年代中期的社会工程实践——通常是无意识地——复制了几十年前大规模社会工程开发的许多技术。我们在电话飞客和黑客的技术中看到了一套概念和实践，它们弥补了 20 世纪早期大规模社会工程与大规模个人社会工程之间的差距。我们还看到，在社会科学理论层面，尤其是当这些理论与传播有关时，所有类型的社会工程都有所融合。

Indeed, as our book will explore in more detail, this mid-1970s practice of social engineering replicated—often unconsciously—many of the techniques developed by the mass social engineers of decades prior. We see in the phone phreaks’ and hackers’ techniques a set of concepts and practices that bridge the gap between the mass social engineering of the early twentieth century and of masspersonal social engineering. We also see convergences among all types of social engineering at the level of social science theories, especially as those theories pertain to communication.

结论

Conclusion

尽管人们担心大规模社会工程，并在 20 世纪 70 年代转向个人主义，但大规模和人际社会工程之间的差距并不像最初看起来那么大。综合起来，这两种形式都揭示了一系列能够针对个人（如飞客和黑客所做的那样）但具有社会影响（如大规模社会工程师所追求的那样）的技术。

Despite the fears of mass social engineering and the turn to individualism in the 1970s, the gap between the mass and interpersonal forms of social engineering is not as wide as it may initially appear. Taken together, both forms reveal a spectrum of techniques capable of targeting individuals (as the phreaks and hackers did) but with societal implications (as the mass social engineers sought to have).

正如我们在引言中讨论的那样，我们认为大众个人社会工程是奥沙利文和卡尔所称的大众个人传播这一更广泛现象的一部分。46但我们也受到了他们在工作中采用的方法论方法的启发。他们指出，计算机中介传播的最新发展，尤其是互联网和社交媒体，凸显了大众传播模式和人际传播模式之间的模糊界限，而这两种模式在 20 世纪的大部分时间里都是主流传播理论的核心。但他们并没有将这种模糊的界限视为一种全新的、由技术决定的现象，而是将其视为一个机会，“看看类似的现象是否在旧技术中存在过”。因此，寻找看似新现象的历史例子或先兆，提供了机会来修改和“更准确、更全面地解释传播现象”，“重新评估一些基本假设”，并在此过程中“通过提出修订的假设来推进传播学科”。在他们的案例中，对新兴数字通信技术及其使用的考察使他们能够“挑战通信领域中一个持久的框架”，即“人际传播和大众传播之间的定义鸿沟” 。47

As we discussed in the introduction, we see masspersonal social engineering as part of the broader phenomenon that O’Sullivan and Carr have called masspersonal communication.46 But we have also been inspired by the methodological approach that they take in their work. They note that recent developments in computer-mediated communication, in particular the internet and social media, highlight the blurring boundary between mass and interpersonal models of communication that were at the core of dominant communication theory for most of the twentieth century. But instead of seeing that blurring boundary as something entirely new and technologically determined, they see it as an opportunity “to see if similar phenomena have existed with older technologies.” Looking for historical examples or precursors to a seemingly new phenomenon provides the opportunity, therefore, to revise and “explain communicative phenomenon more precisely and comprehensively,” “to reassess some basic assumptions,” and, in doing so, “to advance the communication discipline by proposing revised assumptions.” In their case, an examination of emerging digital communication technologies and their use allows them to “challenge one of the enduring frameworks” of communication, which is “the definitional divide between interpersonal and mass communication.”47

同样，我们在下一节中的方法将是采用较新的黑客社会工程形式，并考虑如何在较旧的大规模形式。具体来说，我们将借鉴黑客社会工程学的文献——地下杂志和在线论坛、播客、文章和书籍——来说明信息收集（破坏）、场景开发（借口）、参与（胡说）和成功（渗透）的步骤。但我们不会将这些做法视为与过去的彻底决裂，而是将它们作为回顾上一章讨论的大规模社会工程学的镜头。我们还将展望当代大规模个人社会工程学的实践，其特点是破坏、借口、胡说和渗透。这些跨越过去一个世纪的时间运动将进一步弥合所有社会工程学形式之间的差距。

Similarly, our approach in the next section will be to take up the more recent form of hacker social engineering and consider the ways in which its practices can be found in the older, mass form. Specifically, we will draw on the literature of hacker social engineers—underground magazines and online forums, podcasts, articles, and books—to illustrate steps of information gathering (trashing), scenario development (pretexting), engagement (bullshitting), and success (penetrating). But rather than treat these practices as a radical break with the past, we will use them as lenses to look backward at the mass social engineering we discussed in the previous chapter. And we will also look forward to the contemporary practice of masspersonal social engineering as marked by trashing, pretexting, bullshitting, and penetrating. These temporal motions across the past century will further bridge the gaps between all of the forms of social engineering.

二

II

社会工程过程

The Social Engineering Process

3

3

垃圾处理：从翻找垃圾到数据转储

Trashing: From Dumpster Diving to Data Dumps

垃圾学的主要教训是：人们会忘记，会掩盖，会自欺欺人，会撒谎。但他们的垃圾总是说真话。

Here’s the main lesson of garbology: People forget, they cover, they kid themselves, they lie. But their trash always tells the truth.

—威廉·拉特克1

—William Rathke1

如果你长时间盯着垃圾箱，它们就会盯着你。

Stare into dumpsters long enough and they stare into YOU.

—约翰·霍夫曼，《翻垃圾桶的艺术与科学2》

—John Hoffman, The Art & Science of Dumpster Diving2

一切都从垃圾开始。

It all starts with trash.

米歇尔·斯拉塔拉 (Michelle Slatalla) 和约书亚·奎特纳 (Joshua Quittner) 撰写的《欺骗大师》一书讲述了 20 世纪 80 年代末纽约市同名黑客组织的故事，开篇是一位名叫保罗的少年在皇后区阿斯托利亚的一个垃圾箱里：

The book Masters of Deception, by Michelle Slatalla and Joshua Quittner, is a story of the late 1980s New York City–based hacker group of the same name, opens with a teenager named Paul in a dumpster in Astoria, Queens:

这是成为电脑黑客的一种方式，也是保罗选择的方式。他试图抓住垃圾箱底部五六个诱人的鼓鼓囊囊中的一个。……他最想待的地方就是这里，在这条黑暗的小巷里，在堆满电话公司垃圾的垃圾箱里翻找电脑打印件。3

This is one way to become a computer hacker, the way Paul has chosen. He tries to snare one of the five or six invitingly swollen bags that sit in the bottom of the dumpster. . . . There’s nowhere he’d rather be than here, rummaging around in this dark alley in a dumpster full of phone company trash, looking for computer printouts.3

保罗和他的“欺骗大师”同胞们继续着电话飞客和黑客长期以来备受推崇的破坏行为—— “在垃圾堆里翻找，希望能找到列有秘密密码和登录信息的计算机打印件。” 4电话飞客和黑客至少从 20 世纪 70 年代中期就开始使用破坏行为，其复杂性已在《电话电子线》、《技术援助计划》和《2600》等杂志以及计算机公告板帖子中讨论过。5
