But this was a tiny fraction of the tens of thousands he had sent with the deceptive information.52 Moreover, “despite Lee’s efforts to rectify the problem, copies were still being circulated without the correction.”53 And none of this addresses the fact that Lee did not disclose that the Rockefellers were behind his bulletins, belying his promise to provide “full information . . . concerning those on whose behalf an article is sent out.” And although Lee was chastened when his bullshit was called out by the Commission, he repeated his tactics on behalf of coal mine operators in West Virginia just a few years after Ludlow.54

李的工作是典型的大规模社会工程骗局——在展示科罗拉多州煤矿开采的统计数据时，他以事实和准确性为荣，但同时欺骗读者，隐瞒消息来源，兜售支持其公关使命的不实信息。拉德洛屠杀的真相与此无关。他的目的是让公众舆论转向洛克菲勒家族，远离工会，并在原则宣言的道德幌子下做到这一点。55但李确实坚持了至少一部分原则：据说他是一个开朗友好的人。约翰·D·洛克菲勒二世称赞他以“完全善良、有吸引力和令人印象深刻的方式”开展工作。56

Lee’s work was quintessential mass social engineering bullshit—glorying in facts and accuracy when presenting statistics about Colorado coal mining, and yet deceiving readers about his sources and peddling inaccuracies that supported his public relations mission. The truth of the Ludlow Massacre was beside the point. The point was to sway public opinion towards the Rockefellers and away from the union, and to do so behind the ethical veneer of a declaration of principles.55 But Lee did adhere to at least one part of his principles: he was, by all accounts, cheerful and friendly. John D. Rockefeller Jr. commended him for doing his work in an “entirely good natured, attractive, and impressive manner.”56

尽管李的胡说八道，或许正因为如此，他现在被认为是公共关系领域的奠基者。直到今天，公共关系专业人士仍将他的《原则宣言》视为现代公共关系领域的开端。57然而，美国研究学者乔纳森·奥尔巴赫指出，虽然艾维·李最有资格获得“公共关系之父”的称号，但大多数学者将这一荣誉归于爱德华·伯内斯。这是因为伯内斯

Despite Lee’s bullshitting, or perhaps because of it, he is now considered a foundational figure in the field of public relations. To this day, public relations professionals point to his “Declaration of Principles” as the start of the modern field.57 However, American studies scholar Jonathan Auerbach notes that, while Ivy Lee has the best claim to the title “father of public relations,” most scholarship gives that honor to Edward Bernays. This is because Bernays

很高兴将自己称为公共关系之父，尽管他显然比李晚了整整十年。考虑到影响力而非资历，我再次坚持认为李仍然是公共关系史上更重要的人物，尽管伯内斯不懈地吹嘘自己。事实很简单，伯内斯比李更有趣、更华丽。他也是一位更出色的自我推销者和宣传者。58

was happy to put himself forward as the father of public relations, even though he clearly came on the scene a full decade after Lee. Considering influence rather than seniority, I would again insist that Lee remains the more important figure in the history of public relations, despite Bernays’s relentless efforts to toot his own horn. The simple fact is that Bernays was more fun and flamboyant than Lee. He was also a far better self-promoter and propagandist for propaganda.58

换句话说，伯内斯的吹牛技术甚至比李更高明。李是一位迷人而和蔼可亲的人物，他以“公关之父”的身份把自己吹捧到聚光灯下。

In other words, Bernays was an even better bullshitter than Lee, a charming and affable character who bullshitted himself into the limelight as the “father of PR.”

多位伯内斯学者指出，他夸大了自己运动的成功。例如，在他漫长的一生中，他夸大了自由火炬游行的影响，这是他和弗莱施曼为美国烟草公司策划的活动。1929 年，在纽约市复活节游行中，一些女性在火炬游行中吸烟，用伯内斯的话来说，目的是“打破禁止女性吸烟的禁忌”。59在伯内斯的人生叙述中，这一事件从一个小事件发展成为美国烟草史上最具变革性的时刻，每家主要报纸都对其进行了报道，并成为美国女性吸烟的唯一原因。60在公共关系博物馆的一次视频采访中，祖父般的伯内斯声称，自由火炬游行的第二天，“美国没有一家报纸 [忽略了这一报道]。甚至连《纽约时报》都在头版刊登了一篇文章，‘初入社交界的少女点燃自由火炬，抗议男人通过禁止吸烟对女性的不人道行为’。”虽然《纽约时报》确实在头版刊登了复活节游行的报道，但标题实际上是“复活节的阳光在现代游行中发现过去的阴影”。他引用的短语根本不存在，吸烟的女性也只是顺便提及。61此外，伯内斯对此次事件影响的判断也是错误的：在游行之前的几年里，女性就已经在公共场所吸烟，而对此次事件的报道远没有伯内斯声称的那么广泛。62伯内斯显然希望我们相信他的大规模社会工程能力，所以他对此大肆吹嘘。

Multiple scholars of Bernays note that he exaggerated the success of his own campaigns. For example, over the course of his long life, he overstated the impact of his Torches of Freedom march, the event he and Fleischman concocted for the American Tobacco Company. The Torches march included a few women smoking while marching in the 1929 Easter Parade in New York City in order to, in his words, “smash the taboo against women smoking.”59 In Bernays’s telling of his life, the event went from being a minor one to the most transformative moment in American tobacco history, being covered in every major newspaper and being the single reason why women smoked in America.60 In a video interview in the Museum of Public Relations, a grandfatherly Bernays claims that the day after the Torches of Freedom march, “there wasn’t a newspaper in the United States [ignoring the story.] Even the New York Times had a front page story, ‘Debutantes Light Torches of Freedom To Protest Man’s Inhumanity to Women by a Taboo Against Smoking.’” While it’s accurate to say that the Times had a front-page story on the Easter parade, the headline was, in fact, “Easter Sun Finds The Past In Shadow at Modern Parade.” The phrase he quotes is non-existent, and the smoking women are mentioned only in passing.61 In addition, Bernays was also wrong about the impact of the event: women had smoked in public for years prior to the march and the coverage of the event was far less extensive than Bernays claimed.62 Bernays obviously had a stake in our believing in his mass social engineering prowess, so he bullshitted about it.

最引人注目的是——尽管伯内斯发起了帮助女性享受吸烟自由的伪女权主义运动——但他想成为“公关之父”的动力却导致他完全抹杀了那些可以自称“公共关系之母”的人的工作。他的妻子多丽丝·弗莱施曼在这一领域的发展中所起的作用甚至比艾维·李还要少，尽管她是他们公关公司的平等合伙人，并在发展大规模社会工程理论方面做了许多关键工作。63伯内斯不给予他的伴侣应得的荣誉的原因是什么？女性在职业中是一种禁忌，他的客户不会接受弗莱施曼。64这就是打破禁忌的行为。

Most strikingly—despite his pseudo-feminist campaigns to help women enjoy the freedom of smoking—Bernays’s drive to be the “father of PR” led to him completely erasing the work of someone who might claim the title “the mother of public relations.” His wife, Doris Fleischman, gets even less credit than Ivy Lee for her role in developing the field, despite the fact that she was an equal partner in their public relations firm and did much of the key work in developing theories of mass social engineering.63 Bernays’s reason for not giving his partner her deserved credit? There was a taboo on women in professions, and his clients wouldn’t accept Fleischman.64 So much for taboo-smashing.

大众社会工程师中猖獗的胡说八道可能是法兰克福毫不留情地批评他们的原因：

The rampant bullshitting among mass social engineers may be why Frankfurt was unsparing in his criticism of them:

广告和公共关系领域，以及如今密切相关的政治领域，充斥着如此赤裸裸的胡说八道，以至于它们可以成为这一概念最无可争议和最经典的范例。65

The realms of advertising and of public relations, and the nowadays closely related realm of politics, are replete with instances of bullshit so unmitigated that they can serve among the most indisputable and classic paradigms of the concept.65

虽然网络飞客至少诚实地称他们所做的是“胡说八道”，但大众社会工程师才是现代美国思想中最与这种做法联系在一起的人，他们在大众媒体上将欺骗、事实和友好混合在一起。李和伯内斯至今仍是公共关系领域的著名人物。我们应该感谢他们精心编造的胡说八道。

While the phreaks were at least honest in calling what they did “bullshit,” the mass social engineers are the ones most associated with the practice in modern American thought, mixing deception, facts, and friendliness together on a mass media scale. Lee and Bernays are, to this day, celebrated figures in the field of public relations. We owe them a debt of gratitude for their finely crafted bullshit.

结论

Conclusion

社会工程师——无论是大众、人际还是其他——都是胡说八道者。社会工程学是一种艺术性的、无视真相的混合体，它融合了欺骗、准确信息、内幕知识、友好、胡说八道、奉承和自我吹嘘。胡说八道为社会工程师提供了一套灵活的沟通技巧。它很善于交际，但目的却是：保持借口，获取有价值的信息，访问受限技术或网络，或通过媒体信息控制人群。总之，胡说八道是社会工程师选择的参与策略。无论是电话飞客打电话给接线员，黑客社会工程师发送网络钓鱼电子邮件，还是公关公司开展媒体活动，胡说八道总是不可或缺的。胡说八道很危险，能够从根本上破坏我们的信任。

Social engineers—mass, interpersonal, or otherwise—are bullshitters. Social engineering is an artistic, truth-indifferent mix of deception, accurate information, insider knowledge, friendliness, talking out of one’s ass, flattery, and self-aggrandizement. Bullshitting offers a flexible suite of communication skills for the social engineer. It is sociable, but with instrumental goals: to keep the pretext alive and to get valuable information, access to restricted technologies or networks, or control of crowds through media messaging. Bullshitting, in sum, is the social engineer’s engagement tactic of choice. Whether it is a phone phreak calling up an operator, a hacker social engineer sending a phishing email, or a public relations firm creating a media campaign, bullshit is always involved. Bullshit is dangerous, capable of radically undermining our trust.

那么，如果社会工程学严重依赖胡说八道，我们为什么不把社会工程师赶出去呢？答案很简单：他们声称这样做是为了我们好。我们接下来会谈到这一点。

So, if social engineering relies heavily on bullshitting, why don’t we throw the social engineers out? The answer is simple: they claim to be doing it for our own good. We turn to that next.

6

6

深入人心：控制媒体和思想的欲望

Penetrating: The Desire to Control Media and Minds

记住——一旦你成为一名社会工程师，你就会通过欺骗、操纵和诡计来谋生……但你也会教育他们。

Remember—once you are a social engineer, you deceive, manipulate, and trick people for a living . . . but you also educate them.

—莎朗·康黑迪1

—Sharon Conheady1

“我只想搞砸你，”黑客社会工程师杰森·斯特里特 (Jayson Street) 在 DEF CON 19 上说道。“我只想用最糟糕的方式把你搞得一团糟。我想在最糟糕的时间成为你遇到的最糟糕的事情。” 2

“I just wanna F you up,” says hacker social engineer Jayson Street at DEF CON 19. “I just wanna mess you up in the worst possible way. I wanna be the worst thing to ever happen to you at the worst possible time.”2

Street 正在介绍他的黑客社会工程方法，特别是专业黑客社会工程师所称的“渗透测试”或简称“渗透测试”。他偷过钱包、手机、文件、笔记本电脑，甚至汽车，而这一切都是作为专业渗透测试员受雇寻找组织安全漏洞而获得的报酬。他的演讲题为“窃取一切，杀死所有人，造成彻底的财务崩溃”，听起来恶毒而淫秽。但这是为了实现一个更大的目标：Street 受雇于公司来测试他们的安全性。他不是地下黑客——他是一名专业人士。这个过程的一部分包括教育他“欺骗”过的公司他的测试结果“表明了他们的弱点”。在进行测试后，他编写了报告，旨在向那些认为自己可以免受人际社交工程师攻击的倒霉公司员工传授安全方面的教训。

Street is presenting his approach to hacker social engineering, specifically what professional hacker social engineers call “penetration testing” or “pentesting” for short. He has stolen purses, phones, documents, laptops, even cars, all while being paid to do so as a professional pentester hired to seek flaws in an organization’s security. His talk, titled “Steal Everything, Kill Everyone, Cause Total Financial Ruin” sounds vicious and prurient. But it’s in service to a greater goal: Street is hired by corporations to test their security. He’s not an underground hacker—he’s a professional. Part of the process involves educating the corporations he’s “F’ed up” on their vulnerabilities. After conducting his tests, he produces reports meant to teach lessons about security to the hapless corporate employees who assume they’re safe from interpersonal social engineers.

至少从 20 世纪 60 年代中期开始，专业渗透测试就已正式开始。3 渗透测试可以通过网络和软件进行，早期关于渗透测试的文献大多侧重于寻找计算机操作系统中的软件漏洞。4当然，我们感兴趣的是渗透测试的社会工程迭代——操纵人们以获取系统访问权限以“搞砸它”。专业渗透测试中黑客社会工程的一个早期例子发生在 1985 年，当时 NASA 聘请了一家计算机安全公司来测试戈达德太空飞行中心的安全性。这家安全公司结合使用了软件和社会工程攻击。与许多其他人一样，安全团队发现社会工程是一种极其有效的渗透安全系统的方法。5

Professional penetration testing of organizations and their information systems has been formally practiced since at least the mid-1960s.3 It can be done over networks and via software, and much of the early literature on pentesting focuses on seeking out software exploits in computer operating systems.4 Our interest here is, of course, the social engineering iteration of pentesting—the manipulation of people in order to gain access to a system to “F it up.” An early example of hacker social engineering in professional pentesting occurred in 1985, when NASA hired a computer security firm to test the security of the Goddard Space Flight Center. The security firm used a combination of software and social engineering attacks. Like so many others, the security team found that social engineering was an extremely effective method for penetrating security systems.5

现在，整个社会工程渗透测试服务行业都可供雇用。Jayson Street、Sharon Conheady、Jenny Radcliffe、Johnny Long、Chris Hadnagy 和 Kevin Mitnick 等安全顾问专门利用社会工程学入侵企业系统和建筑物。不想聘请外部顾问的公司可能会选择雇用自己的内部“红队”来运行定期渗透测试。

An entire industry of social engineering penetration testing services is now available for hire. Security consultants like Jayson Street, Sharon Conheady, Jenny Radcliffe, Johnny Long, Chris Hadnagy, and Kevin Mitnick specialize in using social engineering to break into corporate systems and buildings. Corporations that don’t want to hire outside consultants may opt to hire their own internal “Red Teams” to run regular pentests.

就像我们在本书中探讨的其他黑客社会工程术语一样，渗透具有丰富的内涵，使其成为观察其他形式社会工程的有力视角。我们将像往常一样，首先概述人际黑客社会工程师如何使用这个术语，然后将注意力转向大众社会工程师如何依赖渗透逻辑。我们将看到渗透隐喻——具体来说，男性性征服和子弹——在我们追踪人际和大规模社会工程通过沟通来控制的欲望。我们将考虑社会工程渗透是如何专业化的，包括社会科学理论、标准化方法和衡量成功的指标。我们还将看到，所有社会工程师不仅出于对统治的渴望，而且为了教育我们其他人被渗透的危险而“搞砸我们”。他们渗透我们是为了我们好。

Like the other hacker social engineering terms that we’re exploring in this book, penetration has a rich set of connotations, making it a powerful lens through which to look at other forms of social engineering. We’ll start, as usual, with an overview of how interpersonal hacker social engineers have used this term, and then turn our attention to how mass social engineers also rely on logics of penetration. We will see penetrating metaphors—specifically, male sexual conquest and bullets—as we trace both interpersonal and mass social engineering’s desire for control through communication. We will consider how social engineering penetration was professionalized, complete with social scientific theories, standardized methodologies, and metrics for gauging success. And we will also see how all social engineers “F us up” not just out of a desire for domination, but also in order to educate the rest of us about the dangers of being penetrated. They penetrate us for our own good.

人际渗透隐喻：性征服

Interpersonal Penetration Metaphor: Sexual Conquest

Hadnagy 在《社会工程学：人类黑客科学》中写道，黑客术语“渗透测试” “会引出一系列不幽默的性暗示”。他接着谴责那些声称自己“强奸”了计算机服务器的渗透测试人员。“我觉得这种说法一点也不好笑，”他说。令人钦佩的是，Hadnagy 要求他的同事永远不要使用这样的语言，并指出这会让很多人远离这个领域。6

The hacker term “penetration testing,” writes Hadnagy in Social Engineering: The Science of Human Hacking, “opens itself up for a slew of non-humorous sexual innuendos.” He goes on to decry pentesters who claim they have “raped” computer servers. “I do not find that statement funny,” he says. Admirably, Hadnagy demands that his colleagues never use such language, noting that it will turn many people away from the field.6

但事实是，黑客社会工程学长期以来一直用性隐喻来表达“渗透”，甚至是暴力和厌女的隐喻，而且他们很可能会继续这样做。我们不能忽视这种内涵。再次，尽管黑客用语有些粗俗，但“渗透”这样的术语揭示了潜在的逻辑。在这种情况下，渗透作为隐喻性的性支配，包含技术掌握和控制的表达，通常以超男性化的方式呈现。黑客将社会工程学视为对他人的人际操纵，这种观点严重沉迷于这种技术、控制和男性气概的表达。

But the fact is that hacker social engineers have long articulated “penetration” with sexual metaphors—even violent and misogynistic ones—and they will likely continue to do so. We cannot ignore this connotation. Once again, despite some of the crudity of hacker parlance, a term such as “penetration” reveals underlying logics. In this case, penetration as metaphorical sexual domination contains articulations of technical mastery and control, often presented in a hyper-masculinized manner. The hacker vision of social engineering as the interpersonal manipulation of other people heavily indulges in this articulation of technique, control, and masculinity.

正如我们所说，黑客社会工程是黑客行为的社会方面，这与黑客是孤僻不合群的人、坐在只有电脑屏幕亮光的黑暗房间里的想法相矛盾。它也与黑客完全依赖于对电子计算技术的掌握的想法相矛盾。相反，社会工程涉及与他人沟通。因此，黑客社会工程学可能涉及我们称之为“软技能”或“人际交往技能”的能力。冒着性别本质主义的风险，我们甚至可以说这些技能与女性化的价值观有关。7

As we have argued, hacker social engineering is the social side of hacking, belying the idea that hackers are antisocial loners sitting in darkened rooms lit only with the glow of computer screens. It also belies the idea that hackers rely exclusively on mastery of electronic computing technology. Instead, social engineering involves communicating with others. As such, hacker social engineering arguably involves abilities we might call “soft skills” or “people skills.” Running the risk of gender essentialism, we may even say such skills are associated with feminized values.7

然而，尽管黑客社会工程学可能与“软”甚至是女性化的社交技能有关，而且表面上缺乏技术性，但它往往被认为是一种高度合理化和技术化的实践。正如女性主义科技学者所表明的那样，理性和技术性的价值观往往与男性气质有关。8这种表达在黑客行为中非常强烈，因为“黑客构建了一个比计算机科学中已经存在的男性偏见更男性化的版本。” 9具体来说，对于人际黑客社会工程学，当我们考虑其潜在的社会性和人类交流理论概念时，我们会将其他人视为可知、透明、可操纵的对象，就像电子计算机一样可编程。除此之外，对象的操纵者——黑客社会工程师——被视为有思想、自控、精于算计的主体。黑客社会工程学告诉我们，在正确的时间说正确的话，你就可以让目标按照你的意愿行事，美国海军学院教授约瑟夫·哈特菲尔德恰如其分地将这一过程称为“技术统治”。10因此，社会工程学将人类视为可控制的对象，是渗透信息系统的一种手段。黑客社会工程学体现了男子气概、控制力和社交技巧。

However, despite its possible associations with “soft” or even feminized social skills and its ostensible lack of techne, hacker social engineering is often presented as a highly rationalized and technical practice. As feminist scholars of science and technology have shown, values of rationality and technicity are often articulated with masculinity.8 Such an articulation is very strong in hacking, because “hackers construct a more intensely masculine version of the already existing male bias in the computer sciences.”9 As for interpersonal hacker social engineering specifically, when we consider its underlying theoretical conceptions of sociality and human communication, we get a vision of other humans as knowable, transparent, manipulable objects, just as programmable as an electronic computer. Alongside this, the manipulator of the object—the hacker social engineer—is seen as a mindful, self-controlled, calculating subject. Say the right things at the right time, the hacker social engineer tells us, and you can get your target to do as you wish, a process US Naval Academy professor Joseph Hatfield aptly calls “technocratic dominance.”10 Social engineering thus sees humans as controllable objects, a means to the end of penetrating information systems. Masculinity, control, and social skill are articulated in hacker social engineering.

这种表述以“渗透测试”的标签出现——并带有 Hadnagy 所谴责的性暗示——并非历史的偶然。人际黑客社会工程师经常与男性化的搭讪艺术世界联系在一起。搭讪艺术家训练自己和其他男性如何与尽可能多的女性发生性关系。正如男性气概研究学者所言，搭讪艺术可以理解为“书呆子男性化”。书呆子男性气概重视“理性和技术“能力”将女性排除在外，并借鉴了电脑游戏的逻辑，在有规则的空间里，玩家作为化身可以实现超人的壮举。11

That this articulation appears under the label “penetration testing”—bringing with it the sexual innuendos Hadnagy decries—is not a historical accident. Interpersonal hacker social engineers have often associated with the hypermasculine world of pickup artistry. Pickup artists train themselves and other men on how to have sex with as many women as possible. As masculinity studies scholars argue, pickup artistry can be understood as “nerd masculine.” Nerd masculinity values “rationality and technological proficiency,” keeps women excluded, and draws on the logics of computer games, rule-bound spaces where the player qua avatar can achieve superhuman feats.11

作为一个充满书呆子气息的男性领域，搭讪艺术与电脑黑客有着相似之处。更重要的是，它们有着共同的历史。一个关键的例子是刘易斯·德·佩恩。德·佩恩因多种原因而闻名：他以化名罗斯科 (Roscoe) 领导“罗斯科帮”，这是一支位于洛杉矶的电话飞客和黑客团伙，成员包括凯文·米特尼克 (Kevin Mitnick) 和苏珊·“雷霆”·海德利 (Susan “Thunder” Headley)，他们都将社会工程学纳入他们的工具包中，并在 20 世纪 80 年代和 90 年代被记者广泛报道。12但除了是一名社会工程师之外，德·佩恩还因在 20 世纪 90 年代中期创立了互联网上第一个搭讪艺术家讨论论坛之一——Usenet 新闻组 alt.seduction.fast 而闻名。13 alt.seduction.fast 新闻组传播了罗斯·杰弗里斯 (Ross Jeffries) 的教诲，他是“诱惑社区”的创始人之一，也是 20 世纪 70 年代神经语言程序设计 (NLP) 心理理论的支持者。14社会工程师德佩恩 (De Payne) 曾师从杰弗里斯，并在 20 世纪 90 年代精通了杰弗里斯的“快速诱惑”技巧。15记者乔纳森·利特曼 (Jonathan Littman) 在《逃亡游戏》中证实了这一点，甚至在一天下午加入德佩恩一起学习杰弗里斯的诱惑课程。“这是终极技巧，”利特曼在谈到德佩恩使用快速诱惑的方法时写道，“说服女人和电脑迷上床。” 16德佩恩不仅将杰弗里斯的教诲带到了互联网上；他还撰写了一本关于通过计算机公告板服务 (BBS) 进行诱惑的书，名为《感官通道：使用家用计算机诱惑女性的高科技指南》。17

As a nerd masculine field, pickup artistry shares affinities with computer hacking. More to the point, it has a shared history. A key example is Lewis De Payne. De Payne is notable for a variety of reasons: under his pseudonym Roscoe, he was the leader of the “Roscoe Gang,” a Los Angeles-based group of phone phreaks and hackers that included Kevin Mitnick and Susan “Thunder” Headley, all of whom included social engineering in their toolkits and were written about extensively by journalists in the 1980s and 1990s.12 But in addition to being a social engineer, De Payne is also notable for founding one of the internet’s first pickup artist discussion forums, the Usenet newsgroup alt.seduction.fast, in the mid-1990s.13 The alt.seduction.fast newsgroup distributed the teachings of Ross Jeffries, one of the founding fathers of the “seduction community” and a proponent of the 1970s-era psychological theory of neuro-linguistic programming (NLP).14 The social engineer De Payne studied with Jeffries and became well versed in Jeffries’ techniques of “speed seduction” in his own right in the 1990s.15 Journalist Jonathan Littman verifies this in The Fugitive Game, even joining De Payne one afternoon to study Jeffries’s seduction course. “It’s the ultimate hack,” Littman writes of De Payne’s use of speed seduction, “talking women into going to bed with a computer nerd.”16 De Payne not only brought the teachings of Jeffries to the internet; he also authored his own book on seduction via computer Bulletin Board Services (BBSs), titled Sensual Access: The High Tech Guide to Seducing Women Using Your Home Computer.17

后来，在 2010 年代初期，手机飞客转型为搭讪艺术家的 Jordan Harbinger 进一步加强了搭讪艺术家与社会工程师之间的关系。2012 年，Harbinger 加入了 Hadnagy 的Social-Engineer.org 播客，在讨论社会工程学时提供搭讪艺术家的视角。18他是他在播客中主持了三年半。在加入 Hadnagy 的播客之前，Harbinger 是另一个播客《魅力的艺术》的联合主持人，该播客自 2007 年 1 月开始播出，包括《不再是好人》、《联系的化学反应》和《女人对自信的男人有什么看法》等剧集。19他还是另一个播客《搭讪》和 Sirius 电台约会咨询脱口秀《游戏开始》的资深主持人。20但像 De Payne 一样，Harbinger 不仅仅是一个搭讪艺术家，他还是一个电话飞客。他儿时的爱好是探索电话网络。他对手机的工作原理很着迷，并想控制它们。他甚至在2600留言板上发布了有关手机黑客的信息。21因此，像他的前辈 De Payne 一样，Harbinger 把搭讪艺术和黑客两个领域的知识带到了Social-Engineer.org 播客中。

Later, in the early 2010s, the pickup artist/social engineer relationship was further strengthened by a cell phone phreak turned pickup artist Jordan Harbinger. In 2012, Harbinger joined Hadnagy’s Social-Engineer.org Podcast to provide the perspective of a pickup artist in discussions of social engineering.18 He was a member of the podcast for three and a half years. Prior to joining Hadnagy’s podcast, Harbinger was the co-host of another podcast, The Art of Charm, which had been running since January 2007 and featured episodes such as “No More Mr. Nice Guy,” “The Chemistry of Connection,” and “What Women Think About Confident Men.”19 He was also the veteran of another podcast, The Pickup, and of a dating consultation talk show on Sirius Radio called Game On.20 But like De Payne, Harbinger was not merely a pickup artist; he was also a phone phreak. His childhood hobby was exploring phone networks. He was fascinated by how cellphones worked and wanted to control them. He even posted information about cellphone hacking to the 2600 message board.21 Thus, like De Payne before him, Harbinger brought knowledge from two domains, pickup artistry and hacking, to the Social-Engineer.org Podcast.

显然，在那些痴迷于性的泡妞技巧的男性中，“插入”具有字面意义。但泡妞技巧最相关的方面是其对控制他人的强调。泡妞技巧将他人（在本例中是女性）物化，并声称可以通过适当的行为刺激来操纵和​​控制女性对象。举一个令人不安的例子，请考虑泡妞技巧德里克·雷克的“幕府将军方法”的“精神控制”。22雷克的目标是“在情感上奴役”女性，他依靠一系列系统化的口头和非口头交流技巧来实现这一目标。泡妞技巧在很大程度上依赖于这样一种自负，即其他人是可编程的“神经机器”，因此很容易通过人际交流受到控制。23

Penetration obviously takes on a literal meaning among the sex-obsessed men of pickup artistry. But the most relevant aspect of the pickup artist game is its emphasis on controlling others. Pickup artistry objectifies the other—in this case, women—and claims that the woman-object can be manipulated and controlled with the right behavioral stimuli. For a disturbing example, consider pickup artist Derek Rake’s “Shogun Method” of “mind control.”22 Rake’s goal is “emotionally enslaving” women, and he relies on a range of systematized verbal and nonverbal communicative techniques to do so. Pickup artistry relies heavily on the conceit that other people are programmable “neural machine[s]” who are thus vulnerable to control through interpersonal communication.23

同样，社会工程师的渗透也强调对客体人的控制。哈德纳吉的书中讨论了如何操纵人们的情绪——让他们对他产生同情，或者利用恐惧——让他们采取他想要的行动。24在他的第一本书中，哈德纳吉还支持神经语言编程 (NLP)——这是搭讪艺术家罗斯·杰弗里斯所信奉的心理学理论，尽管 NLP 对可编程的愿景人类的阴谋论屡屡被揭穿。25 Sharon Conheady 的著作《IT安全中的社会工程学》则更为精辟，她利用社会科学分析了权威、互惠和盲目性，以此作为控制她与之互动的人的手段。26

Similarly, penetration among social engineers also emphasizes control of an objectified human. Hadnagy’s books feature discussions of manipulating people’s emotions—getting them to feel sympathy for him, or using fear—to get them to take the actions he wants.24 In his first book, Hadnagy also endorses neuro-linguistic programming (NLP)—the psychological theory that pickup artist Ross Jeffries adhered to, even though NLP’s vision of programmable humans has been repeatedly debunked.25 Sharon Conheady’s book Social Engineering in IT Security is a bit more sophisticated, drawing on social science to analyze authority, reciprocity, and mindlessness as a means to control the people she interacts with.26

当然，全男性的搭讪艺术家与社会工程师之间的区别在于后者可以涵盖的不仅仅是男性。苏珊“雷霆”海德利也许是最显著的例子，她认为女性化的性是一种强大的控制技巧。在 1995 年的 DEF CON 演讲中，她建议女性社会工程师利用性承诺来操纵男性。27最近，随着互联网通信的身份扮演可能性，任何性别认同的社会工程师都可以使用这种控制技巧；一个著名的例子是罗宾·塞奇实验，其中一个假的“辣妹”角色被用来操纵国防工业的成员。28搭讪艺术家和电话飞客乔丹·哈宾格自己复制了罗宾·塞奇实验，使用基于他“美丽的 [女] 助理”的虚假 LinkedIn 个人资料来收集具有最高安全权限的人的个人信息。29

Of course, a distinction between the all-male pickup artists and social engineers is that the latter field can include more than just men. Susan “Thunder” Headley is perhaps the most notable example, and she saw feminized sexuality as a powerful technique of control. In her DEF CON presentation in 1995, she recommends that women social engineers use the promise of sex to manipulate men.27 More recently, with the identity-play possibilities of internet communication, social engineers of any gender identity can use this technique of control; a famous example is the Robin Sage experiment, where a fake “hot girl” persona was used to manipulate members of the defense industry.28 The pickup artist and phone phreak Jordan Harbinger replicated the Robin Sage experiment on his own, using a fake LinkedIn profile based on his “gorgeous [female] assistant” to gather the personal information of people with top security clearances.29

归根结底，人际社会工程师渗透的成功在于征服系统，比如计算机或建筑物。黑客约翰尼·朗描述了他能够“随心所欲”地入侵计算机、下载文件、更改服务器内容或删除文件时的喜悦。30至于建筑物，杰森·斯特里特夸口说，“最重要的事实”是“我进去了，好吗？”社会工程师珍妮·拉德克利夫报告说，她已经进入了“很多”建筑物，“太多了，说不完”。31一旦进入，斯特里特或拉德克利夫就可以“搞砸一切”，并造成他们受雇创造的可控混乱。因此，他们控制和操纵的人并不是最终目标：入侵系统本身才是。在这里，人际黑客社会工程师的渗透也与泡妞高手的渗透如出一辙：就像泡妞高手不鼓励只和一个女人安定下来一样——相反，他们的目标是征服尽可能多的女人。尽可能多的人——黑客社会工程师不会专注于任何特定的人。32对他们来说，所有的人都代表着一种达到目的的手段：渗透到下一个系统。

Ultimately, success in penetration among interpersonal social engineers is the conquest of systems, such as computers or buildings. Hacker Johnny Long describes his joy when he is able to “have my way” with penetrated computers, downloading files, altering the contents of the server, or deleting it.30 As for buildings, Jayson Street boasts, the “number 1 fact” is “I’m getting in, ok?” Social engineer Jenny Radcliffe reports she’s gotten into “loads” of buildings, “too many to say.”31 Once inside, Street or Radcliffe can “F everything up” and cause the controlled chaos they are paid to create. Thus, the humans they control and manipulate are not the end goal: penetrating the system itself is. Here, too, penetration among interpersonal hacker social engineers echoes penetration among pickup artists: just as pickup artists are discouraged from settling down with just one woman—instead, their goal is to conquer as many as possible—hacker social engineers do not fixate on any given human.32 All humans, for them, represent a means to an end: the penetration of the next system.

专业渗透

Professional Penetration

专业的渗透测试人员不会免费控制他人并入侵系统。他们通常受雇于关注安全的公司或组织。尽管入侵系统很有趣，但这仍然是一份工作。渗透测试人员在正常工作时间进行测试、撰写安全报告并在会议上介绍他们的发现。33 这与典型的、凌晨 3 点喝着 Mountain Dew 进行黑客攻击的地下世界大不相同，但它可以带来丰厚的利润：美国劳工统计局报告称，专业渗透测试人员的平均工资约为 10 万美元。34

Professional pentesters don’t control people and break into systems for free. They’re hired to do so, often by corporations or organizations that are concerned about security. As much fun as it is to have their way with a system, it’s still a job. Penetration testers work regular business hours to conduct their tests, write up security reports, and present their findings in meetings.33 It’s a far cry from the stereotypical, lulzy hacker underground of Mountain Dew-fueled 3 a.m. hacking, but it can be lucrative: the US Bureau of Labor Statistics reports that median pay for professional pentesters is around $100K.34

渗透测试的专业化体现在本书中记录的黑客术语的变化上。正如我们所展示的，“垃圾”等术语已经转变为听起来很专业的“OSINT”（开源情报）。我们还注意到，黑客社会工程学更常见的名称曾经是“胡说八道”，这个词现在很少使用。这种转变得到了正规教育和职业头衔的支持，例如“渗透测试员”。截至撰写本文时，对社会工程学感兴趣的人可以参加有关该主题的课程，包括亚利桑那大学的硕士课程“MIS 566 渗透测试：道德黑客和社会工程”，或各种私人指导课程，如 Chris Hadnagy 的“2 天社会工程训练营”。35这些课程不仅仅是学习如何胡说八道：它们涵盖了一系列理论、方法和实践，以培养可以聘请进行渗透测试的专业社会工程师。预计查看更多此类课程，因为劳工统计局预测未来十年信息安全行业将增长 32% 。36

Pentesting’s professionalization is reflected in changes in the hacker terms we’ve documented in this book. As we have shown, terms like “trashing” have been transformed into the professional-sounding “OSINT” (open-source intelligence). We’ve also noted that the more common name for hacker social engineering was once “bullshitting,” a term now rarely used. Such transformations have been bolstered by formalized education and career titles such as “penetration tester.” As of this writing, people interested in social engineering can take courses on the topic, including a master’s level course at the University of Arizona, “MIS 566 Penetration Testing: Ethical Hacking and Social Engineering,” or a variety of private instruction courses, such as Chris Hadnagy’s “2-Day Social Engineering Bootcamp.”35 These courses are more than just learning how to bullshit: they encompass a whole range of theories, methods, and practices in order to produce professional social engineers who can be hired to conduct penetration tests. Expect to see more such courses, since the Bureau of Labor Statistics predicts a 32 percent growth in the information security sector over the next decade.36

黑客和电话窃贼这些粗俗的称呼转变为大学课堂和公司董事会会议室中可以接受的术语，反映了地下的、被妖魔化的黑客转变为专业的安全顾问，上演了“理想化的黑客生命周期”的“戏剧性弧线”，黑客们改过自新，不再从事以前的非法活动，并通过在市场上出售他们的技能为社会做出贡献。37苏珊“雷霆”海德利就是一个先驱例子。作为德佩恩的“罗斯科帮”的一员，她在 20 世纪 70 年代末和 80 年代初经常侵入太平洋贝尔的系统。38然而，她摇身一变成为一名专业的渗透测试员，1982 年首次出现在美国广播公司的20/20 节目中，指导杰拉尔多里维拉黑客攻击的细节。39随后，她于 1983 年在美国参议院作证，据报道，她为美国军方提供了社会工程渗透测试。40此后，她在 20 世纪 80 年代和 90 年代期间一直担任职业渗透测试员，之后转向政治、扑克和钱币收藏。41

The transformation of the crude terms of phreaks and hackers into terms acceptable in college classrooms and corporate boardrooms reflects the transformation of underground, vilified hackers into professional security consultants, enacting a “melodramatic arc” of the “idealized lifecycle of the hacker,” where hackers reform, abstain from their previous illegal activities, and contribute to society by selling their skills in the marketplace.37 Susan “Thunder” Headley is a pioneering example. As part of De Payne’s “Roscoe’s Gang,” she regularly broke into Pacific Bell’s systems in the late 1970s and early 1980s.38 However, she transformed herself into a professional penetration tester, first appearing on ABC’s 20/20 in 1982, instructing Geraldo Rivera on the finer points of hacking.39 She then testified to the US Senate in 1983 and reportedly provided a social engineering penetration test to the US military.40 After that, she offered her services as a professional pentester through the 1980s and 1990s before shifting careers to politics, poker, and coin collecting.41

海德利的转变预示了凯文·米特尼克的转变，后者在 20 世纪 90 年代和 21 世纪几乎完全复制了海德利的轨迹。在 20 世纪 90 年代服刑后，米特尼克还出现在国家电视台（这次是 CBS 的《60 分钟》）上，并在美国参议院作证。42 2000年，他写了他的第一本书《欺骗的艺术》。43所有这些成就都是为了实现他的长期目标：建立一家安全咨询公司。2002 年中，他成立了米特尼克安全公司，提供渗透测试的社会工程师服务和培训课程讲师服务，帮助组织的员工识别社会工程行为。44

Headley’s transformation prefigured that of Kevin Mitnick, who would replicate Headley’s trajectory almost exactly in the 1990s and 2000s. After serving his prison sentence in the 1990s, Mitnick also appeared on national television—in this case, CBS’s 60 Minutes—and also testified to the US Senate.42 In 2000, he wrote his first book, The Art of Deception.43 All of these achievements were in service to his longer-term goal: to establish a security consultancy. In mid-2002, he established Mitnick Security, offering his services as a social engineer for penetration testing and as an instructor for training courses to help organizations’ employees recognize social engineering in action.44

虽然 Headley 和 Mitnick 从地下渗透测试发展到了专业化、基于社会工程学的渗透测试，他们两人都没有为该领域的正规化和确保它可以被教授给其他人做出太多贡献。这应该归功于 Chris Hadnagy 和 Sharon Conheady。专业渗透测试的一个关键发展是核心文献的开发。Hadnagy 通过他的播客建立了这样一本文献。从 2009 年推出到现在，Hadnagy 的Social-Engineer.org播客邀请了来自执法部门、学术界、商界和黑客地下组织的嘉宾，他们都怀着同一个目标：探索社会工程学作为渗透测试工具的广阔而多方面的维度。每一期播客的结尾，Hadnagy 都会向嘉宾们提出同一个问题：你们推荐什么书？在随后的十年里，Hadnagy 在一篇博客文章中收集了嘉宾们的推荐。45这是一份超过 150 本书的单子。

While Headley and Mitnick made the leap from underground to professionalized, social engineering-based penetration testing, neither of them did much to formalize the field and ensure that it could be taught to others. Credit for this should go to Chris Hadnagy and Sharon Conheady. A key development in professional penetration testing is the development of a core literature. Hadnagy has built such a literature through his podcast. From its 2009 launch to the present day, Hadnagy’s Social-Engineer.org podcast has brought on guests from law enforcement, academia, business, and the hacker underground, all with the same goal: to explore the expansive, multifaceted dimensions of social engineering as a tool for penetrating testing. And every podcast episode ends with Hadnagy posing the same question to the guests: what books do you recommend? Over the subsequent ten years, Hadnagy has collected his guests’ recommendations on a blog post.45 It’s a list of more than 150 books.

这些书以社会科学理论为主，主要来自进化心理学、传播学、营销学和组织学。Hadnagy 收藏的书籍包括大众社会工程师 Edward Bernays 的作品（《宣传》和《同意工程》）。它包括营销和商业主打作品，如罗伯特·西奥迪尼的《影响力》和戴尔·卡耐基的《如何赢得朋友和影响他人》。46其中包括解读肢体语言和情绪的指南，包括 Paul Ekman 的基础作品。47它还对建立融洽关系（Robin Dreeke 的《这不全是关于“我”），思考（Daniel Kahneman 的《思考，快与慢》）和正念（Ellen Langer 的多本书）进行了分析。48当然，它还包括各种专门关注社会工程学的书籍，例如 Johnny Long 的《无技术黑客》、Mitnick 的几本书以及 Hadnagy 自己的书。49

The books are dominated by social scientific theories drawn predominantly from evolutionary psychology, communication, marketing, and organizational studies. The library collected by Hadnagy includes the work of mass social engineer Edward Bernays (Propaganda and The Engineering of Consent). It includes marketing and business staples, like Robert Cialdini’s Influence, and Dale Carnegie’s How to Win Friends and Influence People.46 It includes guides to reading body language and emotions, including the foundational work of Paul Ekman.47 It also has analyses on building rapport (Robin Dreeke’s It’s Not All About “Me”), thinking (Daniel Kahneman’s Thinking, Fast and Slow), and mindfulness (multiple books by Ellen Langer).48 And, of course, it includes a variety of books specifically focusing on social engineering, such as Johnny Long’s No Tech Hacking, several books by Mitnick, and Hadnagy’s own books.49

这些文献可以帮助专业社会工程师了解社会工程学对渗透测试人员的作用。过去几年的电话飞客可能依靠他们的天赋欺骗贝尔接线员，而当代社会工程师有一系列社会科学概念来解释他们如何控制其他人：互惠、融洽、正念（和心理暗示（如无意识）、微表情和框架。有了这些概念，社会工程师就可以用社会科学术语来描述他们的工作，从而进一步巩固他们的专业地位，提高他们在客户中的自尊，并强化“人是安全中最薄弱的环节”这一观念。

The literature helps professional social engineers understand how social engineering works for penetration testers. Whereas the phone phreaks of years past may have relied on their raw talents as they bullshitted Bell operators, contemporary social engineers have an array of social science concepts to explain how they can control other humans: reciprocity, rapport, mindfulness (and mindlessness), microexpressions, and framing. With these concepts, social engineers can describe their work in social scientific terms, further bolstering their claims to professional status, raising their esteem among clients, and reinforcing the perception that “the human is the weakest link” in security.

因此，专业的社会工程渗透测试文献现在具有稳定的方法，这些理论概念被落实为实用、可报告、企业友好的步骤。Sharon Conheady 的优秀著作《IT 安全中的社会工程》或许对黑客社会工程过程进行了最清晰的阐述。该书的核心章节如下：

As a result, the professional social engineering penetration testing literature now features a stable methodology, an implementation of these theoretical concepts into practical, reportable, corporation-friendly steps. Perhaps the clearest explication of the hacker social engineering process is in Sharon Conheady’s excellent book, Social Engineering in IT Security. The core chapters of that book are:

  • • 第 5 章：“研究和侦察”，包括收集 OSINT 或开源情报，以及久经考验的电话窃听技术；
  • • Chapter 5: “Research and reconnaissance,” which includes gathering OSINT, or open-source intelligence, as well as the time-tested phreak technique of trashing;
  • • 第 6 章：“创建场景”，涉及开发借口，包括装扮角色和开发背景故事；
  • • Chapter 6: “Creating the scenario,” which involves developing the pretext, including dressing the part and developing a backstory;
  • • 第 7 章：“执行社会工程测试”，讨论如何通过电子邮件、电话和当面等各种渠道部署借口；
  • • Chapter 7: “Executing the social engineering test,” which discusses deploying one’s pretext through a variety of channels, including email, telephone, and in person; and
  • • 第 8 章：“撰写社会工程报告”，详细说明了如何向签约测试其安全性的公司报告调查结果。这是任何专业渗透测试人员的必备技能。50
  • • Chapter 8: “Writing the social engineering report,” which details how to report one’s findings to the company that contracted you to test their security. This is a requirement for any professional pentester.50

应该明确的是，我们已将这些步骤作为构建社会工程学谱系的指导方针：关于破坏、借口和胡说八道的章节大致类似于研究和侦察、创建场景和执行阶段。

As should be clear, we have taken these steps as guidelines for constructing our genealogy of social engineering: our chapters on trashing, pretexting, and bullshitting are roughly analogous to the research and reconnaissance, creating a scenario, and executing phases, respectively.

至于最后阶段，即撰写报告，这是渗透——控制他人、征服系统——的时刻。记录下来。这是专业渗透测试的巅峰之作，是客户付钱给专业社会工程师的产品。正如 Conheady 所指出的，报告是将社会工程渗透测试的“乐趣”转录为演示文稿和书面文件中的“无聊”细节的地方。51

As for the final phase, report writing, that is the moment that penetration—the control of others, the conquest of systems—is documented. It is the culmination of a professionalized pentest, the product the client paid the professional social engineer for. As Conheady notes, the report is where the “fun” of social engineering penetration testing is transcribed into “boring” detail in presentations and written documents.51

但是还有另一种专业地展示渗透测试结果的方法，而且更令人兴奋：在黑客会议上发言。杰森·斯特里特和苏珊·海德利在 DEF CON 上的演讲就是两个这样的例子。52与古板的公司报告不同，会议上对人际黑客社会工程渗透的介绍通常会重现渗透的乐趣。斯特里特的演讲充满了“安全漏洞”的图像——电脑未锁、密码留在便签上、智能手机无人看管、门没有上锁。然而，最令人震惊的是他拍摄的那些他能够利用行业惯例绕过保安或公司员工进入敏感区域的视频。53 海德利讲述了她使用诱惑技巧获取密码的故事，以及她习惯向她欺骗的人提供安全提示的故事。他们的黑客观众一次又一次地看到公司安全被渗透，从而获得了一种替代的快感，而斯特里特和海德利则因他们的渗透能力而获得赞誉。

But there is another method of professionally presenting results of a pentest, one that’s a bit more exciting: speaking at hacker conferences. The talks given at DEF CON by Jayson Street and Susan Headley are two such examples.52 Unlike the staid corporate report, the presentation of interpersonal hacker social engineering penetration at a conference often recaptures the fun of penetrating. Street’s presentation is full of images of “security fails”—computers left unlocked, passwords left on Post-it notes, smartphones left unattended, unsecured doors. Most damning, however, are his videos of the security guards or corporate employees he’s able to social engineer, using the practices of his trade to get past them and into sensitive areas.53 For her part, Headley tells her stories about using seduction techniques to get passwords and about her habit of giving security tips to the very people she’s conning. Their audiences of hackers get the vicarious thrill of seeing corporate security penetrated, again and again, while Street and Headley get credit for their abilities to penetrate.

康黑迪对细节的报道沉稳而黑客大会上报道粗俗，两者之间的矛盾反映了“黑客的颠覆性技能与专业认证的标准化目标之间的矛盾”。54黑客社会工程学的权威部分源于地下非法活动，这些活动使它被称为一种危险的知识形式。它的专业化是基于它被企业和军事组织视为一套有用的技能，可以在正式报告和工作时间进行。只有一类人——道德渗透测试员——才能驾驭这种矛盾。

The tension between the staid reporting Conheady details and the more ribald reporting happening at hacker conventions reflects “the tension between the subversive skills of hacking and the standardizing aims of professional certification.”54 Hacker social engineering derives its authority in part from the sort of underground, illicit activities that give it its reputation as a dangerous form of knowledge. Its professionalization is based on it being recognized by corporate and military organizations as a useful set of skills, amenable to formal reports and business hours. It takes a particular type of person—the ethical penetration tester—who can navigate this tension.

大规模社会工程隐喻：子弹

Mass Social Engineering Metaphors: Bullets

正如我们的谱系所示，我们讨论过的人际黑客社会工程学流程和概念可以阐明更古老的大规模社会工程学做法。正如我们可以观察到大规模社会工程学的破坏、借口和胡说八道的变体一样，我们也可以在大规模社会工程学中找到黑客渗透逻辑的前身。

As our genealogy shows, the interpersonal hacker social engineering processes and concepts we’ve discussed throughout can illuminate the practices of the older, mass social engineers. Just as we can observe mass social engineering variants of trashing, pretexting, and bullshitting, we can also find precursors to the hacker logic of penetration in mass social engineering.

和人际黑客社会工程一样，大规模社会工程最终也是为了控制人和系统。但大规模社会工程师颠倒了人与系统之间的关系。在人际黑客社会工程中，社会工程师渗透目标的思想，以此作为渗透电信或计算机系统的手段。在大规模社会工程中，渗透媒体系统，最终目的是渗透人类受众的心灵。尽管如此，大规模社会工程师不仅谈论渗透思想和系统，他们还对沟通的性质及其假定的影响做出与黑客社会工程师类似的假设。

Like interpersonal hacker social engineering, mass social engineering is ultimately about control of people and systems. But mass social engineers reverse the relationship between people and systems. In interpersonal hacker social engineering, the social engineer penetrates the mind of his or her target as a means to penetrating the telecommunication or computer system. In mass social engineering, the media system is penetrated with the ultimate goal of penetrating the hearts and minds of human audiences. Nonetheless, mass social engineers not only talk of penetrating minds and systems, they also make similar assumptions as hacker social engineers about the nature of communication and its supposed effects.

大规模社会工程渗透旨在控制人群。自建国之初，人们就认为通信和媒体技术对美国治理体系的形成和维持至关重要，这反映了美国开国元勋们逐渐形成的共识：媒体技术，尤其是报纸，是将不守规矩的人群转变为具有共同理解和意见的知情公众的关键。55例如，约翰·亚当斯谈到需要通信和交通技术（当时两者基本相同）来将新国家团结在一起。56 1787年，为了应对谢司起义，托马斯·杰斐逊写道，要防止这种“人民的干预”，报纸就必须“渗透到全体人民中”，他说，这些人民应该受过足够的教育，能够阅读并理解它们。57这些主题在 20 世纪早期的大规模社会工程师中得到了放大。

Mass social engineering penetration is directed at mastering crowds. The idea that communication and media technologies were important to the formation and maintenance of the United States system of governance began with the founding of the country and reflected an emerging consensus among the United States’ founders that media technologies, especially the newspaper, were key to turning unruly crowds into informed publics with a shared sense of understanding and opinion.55 For example, John Adams spoke of the need for communication and transportation technologies—which were largely the same in those days—to bind the new nation together.56 In 1787, and in response to Shay’s Rebellion, Thomas Jefferson wrote that the prevention of such “interpositions of the people” required the newspaper to “penetrate the whole mass of the people” who should, he said, be sufficiently educated to read and understand them.57 These themes would become amplified among the mass social engineers of the early twentieth century.

在大众社会工程学中，与后来的黑客相比，渗透式控制人群的隐喻意义有所不同。这个隐喻不是性征服，而是战争武器。大众社会工程学的早期批评者雷·斯坦纳德·贝克 (Ray Stannard Baker) 在 1906 年指出，为铁路行业工作的公关人员如何开展军事式“运动”，并向美国各地的小报纸发射精确的“子弹”——即社论内容。58后来，一战时期的克里尔委员会明确采用了子弹的隐喻。美国研究学者乔纳森·奥尔巴赫指出，乔治·克里尔本人将委员会的信息描述为争夺美国“民心”的“纸子弹”和“弹片”。59这些子弹穿过许多媒体，从报纸和广播等广播系统到更温和的形式，如按钮、街角演讲和招牌。正如奥尔巴赫所写，克里尔委员会的媒体信息“渗透到了美国生活的几乎每个方面”。60 “纸子弹”穿透的隐喻后来成为战时宣传分析家们常用的隐喻。61

Penetration for crowd mastering takes on a different metaphorical meaning among mass social engineers than the later hackers. Instead of sexual conquest, the metaphor was weapons of war. An early critic of mass social engineering, Ray Stannard Baker, noted in 1906 how public relations operatives working for the railroad industry engaged in a military-style “campaign” complete with precise “shots”—that is, editorial content—fired at small newspapers around the United States.58 Later, the WWI-era Creel Committee would adopt the bullet metaphor explicitly. American studies scholar Jonathan Auerbach notes that George Creel himself described the committee’s messages as “paper bullets” and “shrapnel” in a battle for American “hearts and minds.”59 These bullets were shot through many media, from broadcast systems like newspapers and radio to more modest forms like buttons, corner speeches, and sign-boards. As Auerbach writes, Creel Committee media messages “penetrated virtually every aspect of American life.”60 The “paper bullets” penetration metaphor would go on to be a common one among analysts of wartime propaganda.61

这些早期的大规模社会工程尝试意在利用进步社会科学的经验教训，进步社会科学认为，只要能够被媒体信息渗透，人类行为是完全可知和可塑造的。爱德华·伯内斯的职业生涯始于克里尔委员会，他在 1942 年分析美国二战宣传时重复了“纸子弹”的比喻。62他在 1947 年关于“同意工程”的文章中进一步发展了渗透隐喻。他的媒体效果理论毫不含糊：“沟通是策划社会行动同意的关键”，正是因为“言语传达的思想将成为人们自身不可或缺的一部分。” 63他认为，大众社会工程所暗示的思想将彻底渗透人们的思想，以至于人们将按照自己的意愿采取行动。

These early attempts at mass social engineering were meant to exploit the lessons of Progressive social science, which taught that human behavior was fully knowable and malleable, so long as it could be penetrated with media messages. Edward Bernays, who started his career working for the Creel Committee, repeated the “paper bullet” metaphor in his 1942 analysis of US World War II propaganda.62 He developed the penetration metaphor further in his 1947 essay on the “engineering of consent.” His media effects theory was unambiguous: “communication is the key to engineering consent for social action” precisely because “the ideas conveyed by the words will become part and parcel of the people themselves.”63 The minds of the people, he argued, will be so thoroughly penetrated by the ideas suggested by the mass social engineer that the people will then act on their own accord.

总体而言，多丽丝·弗莱希曼、艾维·李、乔治·克里尔、爱德华·伯内斯等人认为，他们可以通过运用科学的大众说服技术来影响个人的看法和行为，并最终影响社会，他们经常用隐喻来谈论这些影响，从而唤起渗透的概念。64正如黑客社会工程后来假设了一种工具主义的传播模式，其中语言是通过对目标进行“编程”（“神经语言学”或其他）来控制的一种手段，大众社会工程遵循传播理论家詹姆斯·凯里所说的“传播传播观”和传播历史学家克里斯托弗·辛普森所说的“传播即支配”。这种工具模型从一开始就定义了美国的传播研究，包括早期的大规模社会工程尝试。正如辛普森所解释的那样，这种传播模式源自第一次世界大战的宣传工作，如克里尔委员会，并在第二次世界大战和冷战初期得到更正式的编纂，

Overall, the mass social engineers Doris Fleichman, Ivy Lee, George Creel, Edward Bernays, and others believed that they could impact individual perceptions and behaviors, and ultimately society through the use of scientific techniques of mass persuasion, and they often spoke of these effects in metaphors invoking the idea of penetration.64 Just as hacker social engineering would later assume an instrumentalist model of communication in which language is a means of control through the “programming” (“neuro-linguistic” or otherwise) of the target, mass social engineers adhered to what communication theorist James Carey called the “transmission view of communication” and communication historian Christopher Simpson called “communication as domination.” This instrumental model has defined US communication studies from the start, including early attempts at mass social engineering. As Simpson explains, this model of communication, which emerged out of WWI propaganda efforts like the Creel Committee and became more formally codified during WWII and the early years of the Cold War,

集中于精英们如何利用现代技术来管理社会变革、获取政治让步或赢得目标受众的购买决策。……这种取向将极其复杂、本质上是社区性的社会传播过程简化为基于说服性（归根结底是强制性）信息传播动态的简单模型。65

concentrated on how modern technology could be used by elites to manage social change, extract political concessions, or win purchasing decisions from targeted audiences. . . . This orientation reduced the extraordinarily complex, inherently communal social process of communication to simple models based on the dynamics of transmission of persuasive—and, in the final analysis, coercive—messages.65

这是作为人群控制的渗透，是用来管理群众的纸子弹。

This is penetration as crowd control, paper bullets meant to manage the masses.

媒体渗透率数据

Media Penetration by the Numbers

就像后来的专业黑客社会工程师一样，大规模社会工程学是为客户进行的，客户要求记录结果。无论人群是否被纸子弹击穿，都需要某种形式的证据。因此，大规模社会工程师努力他们通过报道他们的成功来证明自己的实力，他们选择的方式是基本的量化，最常见的是统计提到客户的新闻报道片段。66简而言之，他们的逻辑是，他们的想法渗透到媒体系统中越深——他们的信息在各种媒体上被提及的次数越多——他们就越有可能渗透到目标受众的心中。

Like the later professional hacker social engineers, mass social engineering was done for clients, who demanded documented results. Whether or not the crowd was penetrated by paper bullets required some form of proof. Thus, mass social engineers worked hard to prove their prowess by reporting on their successes, and the vehicle they chose was basic quantification, most commonly the counting of news stories—clips—mentioning the client.66 Simply put, their logic was that the deeper their ideas penetrated media systems—the more mentions of their messages across various media—the more likely they had penetrated the minds of their target audiences.

弗莱施曼和伯内斯用指标来展示他们代表美国烟草公司所做的工作。为了影响时装设计师使用绿色（从而使好彩香烟包装变得时尚），他们创建了一个色彩时尚局。67 伯内斯和弗莱施曼声称，他们打入时尚界的努力之所以成功，是因为一个基本指标：向他们的借口——时尚局提出的有关绿色的询问。

Fleischman and Bernays present their work on behalf of American Tobacco in metrics. In their effort to influence fashion designers to use the color green (and thus make Lucky Strike cigarette packaging fashionable), they created the pretext of a Color Fashion Bureau.67 Bernays and Fleischman claimed their effort to penetrate the fashion industry to be a success because of a basic metric: inquiries about green made to their pretext, the bureau.

开业仅几个月后，色彩时尚局就收到了大量信息请求——来自 77 家报纸、95 家杂志、29 个辛迪加、301 家百货商店、145 个妇女俱乐部、175 个广播电台、83 家家具和家居装饰制造商、64 位室内装潢师、10 位服装师和 49 位摄影师和插画家。68

Just months after opening, the Color Fashion Bureau was besieged with requests for information—from 77 newspapers, 95 magazines, 29 syndicates, 301 department stores, 145 women’s clubs, 175 radio stations, 83 manufacturers of furniture and home decorations, 64 interior decorators, 10 costumers, and 49 photographers and illustrators.68

我们从弗莱施曼和伯内斯那里得到了如此精确的数据，因为他们认为这些指标是渗透的证据。他们的工作以统计媒体剪辑为标志：伯内斯的《一个想法的传记》以关于他们努力的新闻报道数量之多而感到高兴，而弗莱施曼编辑的贸易杂志《接触》与订阅者分享剪辑，作为他们公司成功的证据。69

We have such precise numbers from Fleischman and Bernays because they saw such metrics as evidence of penetration. Their work is marked by counting media clips: Bernays’s Biography of an Idea delights in the sheer number of news stories about their efforts, and Fleischman’s edited trade magazine Contact shared clips with subscribers as evidence of their firm’s success.69

度量化支持了大众社会工程师的说法，即媒体系统的渗透塑造了群体的看法。艾维·李在 1910 年代代表洛克菲勒家族和煤炭行业开展的竞选活动是“世纪之交政治直邮的雪崩”，数以万计的传单和小册子寄给了美国各地有影响力的人物。70在大量邮件发出后，李通过我们所谓的情绪分析来衡量这些邮件的效果；他聘请了一家剪报服务公司和一位助理分析新闻社论，发现超过一半的社论对洛克菲勒家族和煤炭公司有利。

Metrification bolsters the mass social engineer’s claims that penetration of media systems shapes the perceptions of the crowds. Ivy Lee’s campaign on behalf of the Rockefellers and the coal industry in the 1910s was “a virtual avalanche of turn-of-the-century political direct mail,” with tens of thousands of leaflets and booklets mailed to influential people across the United States.70 After the avalanche of mail was sent, Lee measured the results of this by doing what we might call sentiment analysis; he hired a clipping service and an assistant to analyze news editorials, finding more than half the editorials to be favorable to the Rockefellers and the coal companies.

当然，这种粗略的计量方法与二战后加速发展的传播和媒体研究的更广泛量化相比显得微不足道。正如传播史学家克里斯托弗·辛普森 (Christopher Simpson) 指出的那样，传播研究人员追随大众社会工程师的脚步，将大众媒体视为社会管理的工具和社会冲突的武器。但与大众社会工程师的剪辑计数实践不同，他们提出了更复杂的定量方法——特别是实验和准实验效果研究、随机抽样、民意调查和定量内容分析——作为将传播狭义定义为社会管理的手段。71到20 世纪 50 年代，学术期刊《舆论季刊》上的一篇文章报道说，该领域正在使用一系列标准化的“有效性研究”来衡量他们的信息在媒体系统中的渗透程度：客户“可以购买评级服务，该服务报告电视或杂志观众的规模。[他们] 可以研究 [他们的] 信息在公众各个群体中的渗透程度。[他们] 可以预先测试 [他们的] 广告文案的可读性。” 72尽管复杂程度各不相同，但大众社会工程师和后来的大众传播研究人员都认为，渗透社会就是用他们喜欢的信息渗透媒体系统。在大众社会工程及其社会科学的后代中，渗透是一个数字游戏。要与客户分享结果，请指出您可以计算的内容。

Of course, such crude metrification pales in comparison to the broader quantification of communication and media research that accelerated after World War II. As communication historian Christopher Simpson notes, communication researchers followed the lead of the mass social engineers in order to see mass media as a tool for social management and as a weapon in social conflict. But unlike the clip-counting practices of the mass social engineers, they proposed more complex quantitative approaches—particularly experimental and quasi-experimental effects research, random sampling, opinion surveys, and quantitative content analysis—as a means of narrowly defining communication as social management.71 By the 1950s, an article in the academic journal Public Opinion Quarterly reported that the field was using a range of standardized “effectiveness studies” to gauge how deeply their messages penetrated a media system: clients “may buy a rating service which reports on the size of a television or magazine audience. [They] may study the degree of penetration which [their] message has achieved in various segments of the public. [They] may pretest the readability of [their] advertising copy.”72 Despite the variations in complexity, both the mass social engineers and the later mass communication researchers conceived of penetrating society as a matter of penetrating media systems with their preferred messages. In mass social engineering and its social scientific descendants, penetration is a numbers game. To share results with a client, point to what you can count.

渗透我们是为了我们自己的利益？

Penetrating Us for Our Own Good?

无论他们试图渗透建筑物的安全系统、计算机系统、市场还是国家媒体系统，所有专业的社交无论是大众工程师还是人际工程师，都是代表客户开展工作。大众社会工程师自诩为“公关顾问”，代表希望提高销量或规避监管的公司或希望改善地缘政治地位的政府渗透媒体系统。专业渗透测试人员则以顾问或员工的身份为公司工作，希望发现安全系统中可能存在的漏洞。因此，这些社会工程师与许多其他类型的工程师一样，向当权者提供技术官僚才能。他们渗透我们并不是为了实现更大的理想，而是为了满足那些付钱给他们的人的需求。

Whether they seek to penetrate a building’s security, a computer system, a market, or a national media system, all professional social engineers—mass or interpersonal—do their work on behalf of clients. The mass social engineers style themselves as “public relations counsels,” penetrating media systems on behalf of corporations wanting to improve sales or stave off regulation, or governments wanting to improve their geopolitical positions. Professionalized pentesters do their work as consultants to or employees of corporations who want to discover possible holes in their security systems. Thus, these social engineers—like many other types of engineers—offer their technocratic talents to those in power. They penetrate us not in service to some larger ideal, but rather to meet the needs of those who pay them.

给社会工程师开支票的人会损失惨重。政府担心一些反对派政治运动或政府会破坏其合法性。依赖消费的企业担心人们会停止购买他们销售的产品。组织担心他们的机密会被泄露并在黑市上出售。社会工程师将所有这些问题归结为沟通问题，具体而言是工具性沟通问题，即人们被错误的人传达的错误信息所渗透。这体现在他们将社会工程描述为一个中性过程，一个无价值的“工具”，“坏人”和“好人”都可以使用。事实上，他们认为，坏人已经在这么做了，所以好人也不得不这么做。

The people writing the checks out to social engineers have a lot to lose. Governments fear that some opposing political movement or government will undermine their legitimacy. Corporations dependent upon consumption fear that people will stop buying whatever they’re selling. Organizations fear that their secrets will be exfiltrated and sold in black markets. Social engineers theorize all of these problems as problems of communication—specifically, problems of instrumental communication, where people are being penetrated by the wrong messages from the wrong people. This appears in their characterization of social engineering as a neutral process, a value-free “tool” that can be picked up by both “bad guys” and “good guys” alike. In fact, the bad guys, they argue, are already doing it—so the good guys simply have to.

正如本书所表明的那样，伯内斯、李、弗莱施曼和其他大众社会工程师煽动了人们的恐惧，即普通民众将被政治煽动家控制，而政治煽动家会利用媒体信息渗透“普通人”的思想。伯内斯认为，

As has been shown throughout this book, Bernays, Lee, Fleischman, and other mass social engineers stoked fears that crowds of common people would be controlled by political demagogues who would penetrate the “common man’s” mind with media messages. Bernays argued,

自私自利的人利用了普通人被宣传所左右的事实。这些有权有势的普通人可能会受到符号、文字、图片和行动的影响。宣传可以利用他的偏见、他的爱和恨，以及他未实现的欲望。73

self-seeking men capitalized on the fact that the common man had been swayed . . . by propaganda. This powerful common man could be influenced by symbols, by words, pictures and actions. Appeals could be made to his prejudices, his loves and his hates, to his unfulfilled desires.73

李辩称，

And Lee argued,

群众渴望领导。如果得不到明智的领导，就会得到错误的领导。我们知道，暴民不仅在这个国家，而且在其他国家也经常得到的领导，如果不加以纠正，很容易产生灾难性的后果。74

The crowd craves leadership. If it does not get intelligent leadership, it is going to take fallacious leadership. We know that the leadership which the mob has often received not only in this country but in other countries, unless corrected, is liable to produce disastrous consequences.74

从本质上讲，李、伯内斯、弗莱施曼和其他大众社会工程师认为，对人群的控制和操纵是不可避免的，事实上已经发生了（主要是由德国人和布尔什维克）。

In essence, Lee, Bernays, Fleischman, and other mass social engineers argued that the control and manipulation of crowds was inevitable, and in fact had already happened (predominantly by Germans and Bolsheviks).

从这个意义上说，他们的观察与批评者们的观察不谋而合。新兴影响力产业的批评者，包括约翰·杜威和沃尔特·李普曼等著名人士，都警告人们要警惕“人为操纵和胁迫性舆论的威胁”，并呼吁改革和振兴教育系统和新闻界。75杜威和李普曼所表达的担忧从 20 世纪 30 年代到冷战初期越来越受到关注：

In this sense, their observations map onto those of their critics. Critics of the emerging influence industry, including such prominent voices as John Dewey and Walter Lippmann, warned about the “threat of engineered and coercive opinion” and called for reform and revitalization of both the education system and the press.75 The concerns expressed by Dewey and Lippmann gained increasing traction from the 1930s and into the early years of the Cold War:

随着极权主义政权的崛起，宣传不再被简单地视为一种教育，塑造和组织美国公众的智力；现在，教育正被用来对抗印刷品、广播和电影的力量，所有这些都被视为具有潜在威胁性的胁迫和绥靖形式。76

With the rise of totalitarian regimes, propaganda could no longer be innocently taken as a kind of education, shaping and organizing the intelligence of the American public; now, education was enlisted precisely to counter the power of print, radio, and cinema, all perceived as potentially threatening forms of coercion and pacification.76

这些担忧导致了国会听证会和宣传分析研究所等组织的成立，其目的都是研究纳粹宣传在美国的影响和传播，以及创建教育课程，帮助美国人免受此类宣传的影响。77

These fears resulted in Congressional hearings and the creation of organizations like the Institute for Propaganda Analysis, both with the goal of studying the impact and spread of Nazi propaganda in the United States, as well as the creation of educational curricula to help inoculate Americans against the effects of such propaganda.77

然而，对于大众社会工程师来说，应对同意工程的解决方案不是更多的教育，而是更多的同意工程。1947 年，伯内斯认为，美国人教育的不足意味着领导者有时不能等到人们接受适当的教育后再做出决定。伯内斯说，面对“紧迫的危机和决定”，再加上“美国成年人平均只受过六年教育”，领导者有“义务”利用同意工程来引导公众接受他们的思维方式。教育虽然仍然很重要，但仅靠教育是不够的。“同意工程将永远是教育过程的辅助或合作伙伴。” 78同意工程师自称是道德工程师，他们可以将统治精英的需求转化为现实，并通过媒体信息渗透思想，灵活地打击群众的“错误领导”。正如李在 1915 年所说的那样，如果煽动家能够指挥群众，“为什么不应该用同样的程序来代表建设性的事业，代表那些不会破坏而是真正建设的思想和原则呢？” 79伯内斯赞同李的观点，他指出：“我们必须认识到现代通信的重要性，它不仅仅是一个高度组织化的机械网络，而且是社会良善或可能邪恶的强大力量”，并且同意工程实践“可能会被滥用，有时也会被滥用。煽动家不仅存在于政治领域，而且存在于所有领域。” 80邪恶必须通过工程消除，而不是通过教育来改善。

However, for the mass social engineers, the solution against consent engineering was not more education, but more consent engineering. In 1947, Bernays argued that the inadequacies of Americans’ education meant that leaders sometimes could not wait for people to become properly educated before making a decision. With “pressing crises and decisions” at hand, combined with the fact that “the average American adult has only six years of schooling behind him,” Bernays said, leaders had the “obligation” to use consent engineering to bring the public along to their way of thinking. Education, while still important, would not be enough on its own. “The engineering of consent will always be needed as an adjunct to, or a partner of, the educational process.”78 Consent engineers presented themselves as the ethical engineers who could translate the needs of the ruling elites and nimbly combat “fallacious leadership” of crowds through the penetration of minds qua media messages. As Lee argued in 1915, if demagogues get to direct the crowd, “why should not the same process be utilized on behalf of constructive undertakings, on behalf of ideas and principles which do not tear down but really build up?”79 Bernays echoed Lee’s argument, stating, “We must recognize the significance of modern communications not only as a highly organized mechanical web but as a potent force for social good or possible evil” and also that consent engineering practices “may be and sometimes are abused. There are demagogues not only in politics but in all branches of endeavor.”80 Evil must be engineered away, instead of ameliorated through education.

这种观点一直延续到冷战时期，因为美国政府担心苏联的“心理战”可能对美国人和其他国家产生颠覆性影响。但与此同时，美国政府也开发了自己的政治和心理战工具和技术，用于对付苏联、东欧集团和被认为特别容易受到苏联恶性影响的第三世界国家。81西方大众媒体和教育项目对第三世界国家的渗透是判断“发展”和“现代化”努力成败的关键指标。82同样，在发展努力未能达到预期的情况下，心理战技术被视为打击共产主义叛乱的有力工具。失败了。总之，美国虽然担心宣传在国内的影响，但其最终的立场是“为你宣传，不为我宣传”。

Such views persisted into the Cold War as the United States government worried about the potentially subversive effects of Soviet “psychological warfare” against Americans and others. Though, at the same time, the US government developed its own tools and techniques of political and psychological warfare for use against the Soviets, the Eastern Bloc, and third-world countries believed to be uniquely susceptible to malignant Soviet influence.81 The penetration of Western mass media and education programs into third-world countries was a key metric for judging the success or failure of “development” and “modernization” efforts.82 Likewise, psychological warfare techniques were seen as valuable tools for countering communist insurgencies in cases where development efforts had failed. In short, while the United States worried about the effects of propaganda at home, its ultimate position was propaganda for thee, but not for me.

而专业的黑客社会工程师则遵循类似的逻辑。首先，他们承认，他们所采用的人际社会工程学经常被用于恶意目的。在 Hadnagy 所著的《社会工程学：人类黑客的科学》一书中，他告诉我们

For their part, professional hacker social engineers adhere to similar logics. First, they acknowledge that their brand of interpersonal social engineering is often used for malicious purposes. In his book Social Engineering: The Science of Human Hacking, Hadnagy tells us

我无法控制你如何使用这些信息。你可以读这本书，然后出去攻击别人并窃取他们的信息。或者你可以读这本书，学习如何成为正义的捍卫者。83

I cannot control how you use this information. You can read this book and go out and attack people and steal their information. Or you can read this book and learn how to be a defender for what is right.83

Conheady 的著作《IT 安全中的社会工程学》欢迎我们“进入社会工程学的扭曲和欺骗世界，在这里一切都不是表面看起来的那样。您将要阅读的内容可以用于善事，也可以用于恶事。” 84

And Conheady’s book Social Engineering in IT Security welcomes us “to the twisted and deceitful world of social engineering where nothing is as it seems. What you are about to read can be used for good or evil.”84

事实上，黑客社会工程智慧的邪恶用途早已在我们身边。正如米特尼克在《欺骗的艺术》中所写，我们需要了解“你、你的同事和公司里的其他人是如何被操纵的”。从这个角度来看，社会工程师已经在破坏我们的安全。我们需要学会如何“不再成为受害者”。85我们需要自己成为社会工程师，为“正义”而战。

Indeed, evil uses of hacker social engineering wisdom are, of course, already among us. As Mitnick writes in The Art of Deception, we need to understand “how you, your co-workers, and others in your company are being manipulated.” In this vision, social engineers are already breaking our security. We need to be taught how to “stop being victims.”85 We need to become social engineers ourselves and fight for “what is right.”

为了帮助争取正义，当代专业社会工程师提供服务来教育我们其他人。哈德纳吉特别热衷于建议教育：“我的座右铭，”他写道，“是‘通过教育实现安全’。接受教育是抵御日益严重的社会工程和身份盗窃威胁的唯一可靠方法之一。” 86毕竟，“减少这些攻击影响的唯一真正方法是知道它们的存在，知道它们是如何进行的，并了解做这些事情的人的思维过程和心态。” 87米特尼克和康黑迪使用了类似的语言。

To aid in the fight for what is right, contemporary professional social engineers offer their services to educate the rest of us. Hadnagy is particularly keen to suggest education: “My motto,” he writes, “is ‘security through education.’ Being educated is one of the only surefire ways to remain secure against the increasing threats of social engineering and identity theft.”86 After all, “The only true way to reduce the effect of these attacks is to know that they exist, to know how they are done, and to understand the thinking process and mentality of the people who would do such things.”87 Mitnick and Conheady use similar language.

但最终，哈德纳吉的教育理想——一种民主愿景，让人想起 20 世纪中叶教育人们反对宣传的运动——并没有真正付诸实践。以他的“人类黑客大会”为例，这是一项年度“教育活动，您将接受有关如何破解思想、行动和周围人的专家培训。参加 HHC 所获得的技能和见解将使您在个人和职业上受益匪浅。” 88哈德纳吉的会议和专业社会工程师的书籍并非旨在培训社会各界如何开展社会工程学工作，而是旨在通过教育下一代渗透测试人员来复制专业社会工程学领域。新诞生的专业社会工程师可以继续提供合乎道德的渗透服务来测试大型组织的安全性，并向这些组织提供有关如何改善其安全性的报告。就像大众社会工程师提供他们的同意工程方法来对抗恶意宣传一样，专业社会工程师也提供服务来对抗恶意社会工程师。

But ultimately, Hadnagy’s ideals of education—a democratic vision, redolent of the mid-twentieth-century push to educate people against propaganda—are not quite what gets put into practice. Consider his “Human Hacking Conference,” an annual “educational event where you receive expert training on how to hack thoughts, actions, and the people around you. The skills and insights you gain from attending the HHC benefit you both personally and professionally.”88 Rather than train broad sectors of society on how social engineering works, Hadnagy’s conference, and the books by professional social engineers, are aimed at reproducing the field of professional social engineering by educating the next generation of pentesters. The newly minted professional social engineers can then carry on the legacy of offering ethical penetrating services to test the security of large organizations, providing reports to those organizations on how to improve their security. Much as the mass social engineers offered their consent engineering approach as an antidote to malicious propaganda, professional social engineers offer their services to combat malicious social engineers.

结论

Conclusion

美国研究学者乔纳森·奥尔巴赫 (Jonathan Auerbach) 对大规模社会工程学的看法同样适用于人际黑客社会工程学：他们的渗透能力“既是问题的一部分，也是潜在的解决方案——一种控制和指挥不确定的、分散的公民的方式，但也可能动员和引导他们实现更大的共同利益。” 89部署道德黑客社会工程师是为了“利用黑客的技术权威和神秘感……但又不让黑客背上犯罪活动的污名。” 90如果恶意黑客社会工程师控制你的员工以进入你的公司系统，那么最好的防御就是雇佣某人来攻击、攻陷、控制和渗透这些员工。如果恶意的大规模社会工程师用纸子弹攻击无助的大众，那么按照这种思路，对付拿着信息枪的坏人的唯一可行办法就是雇佣一个拿着装有更多更好纸子弹的信息枪的好人。

What American studies scholar Jonathan Auerbach argues of mass social engineering is equally true of interpersonal hacker social engineering: their penetrative powers are “at once part of the problem as well as a potential solution—a way to control and direct an uncertain, disparate citizenry, but also possibly to mobilize and guide it toward a greater common good.”89 The deployment of ethical hacker social engineers is an attempt to “appropriate the technical authority and mystique of hackers . . . without the stigma of the popular association of hackers with criminal activity.”90 If malicious hacker social engineers are controlling your employees in order to gain access to your corporate systems, then the best defense is to hire someone to hack, pwn, own, and penetrate those same employees. If malicious mass social engineers are hitting the hapless masses with paper bullets, then in this way of thinking, the only viable response to a bad guy with a message gun is to hire a good guy with a message gun loaded with more and better paper bullets.

因此，对渗透的分析告诉我们，掌权者有能力使用社会工程师的诋毁、借口和胡说八道的能力。无论社会工程的目的是制服人群还是控制个人，它通常都是为那些有资源雇佣社会工程师的人服务的。这些人往往就是那些区分好社会工程和坏社会工程的人。由于媒体系统的新发展——特别是企业社交媒体的出现——社会工程有了新的形式：大众个人形式。我们接下来会谈到这一点。

Thus, what this analysis of penetration teaches us is that those in power are the ones in a position to wield the trashing, pretexting, and bullshitting capabilities of social engineers. Whether social engineering is intended to subdue crowds or control individuals, it is most often in the service of those with the resources to hire social engineers. These are often the selfsame people who distinguish between good social engineering and bad. And thanks to new developments in media systems—specifically, the advent of corporate social media—social engineering is available in a new form: a masspersonal form. We turn to that next.

三

III

大规模个人社会工程学

Masspersonal Social Engineering

7

7

当代大众个人社会工程学

Contemporary Masspersonal Social Engineering

在这场新的战争中，美国选民成为混乱、操纵和欺骗的目标。真相被另类叙事和虚拟现实所取代。

In this new war, the American voter became a target of confusion, manipulation, and deception. Truth was replaced by alternative narratives and virtual realities.

—Christopher Wylie 1

—Christopher Wylie1

在本章中，我们将回顾俄罗斯和剑桥分析公司试图干预和操纵选举的案例，以帮助我们详细阐述大规模个人社会工程的概念。我们关注 2016 年，并不是要对这些事件提供权威的解释，而是要将它们作为一个窗口，让我们了解前几章讨论过的大规模和人际社会工程形式之间正在出现的交集和界限的模糊。虽然我们也将讨论大规模个人社会工程实践的更多近期例子，但 2016 年的案例仍然是记录最详尽的。正因为如此，2016 年的俄罗斯行动和剑桥分析公司将成为我们本章的主要关注点。

In this chapter, we return to the cases of Russia’s and Cambridge Analytica’s attempts at election interference and manipulation to help us elaborate on the concept of masspersonal social engineering. By focusing on 2016, we do not mean to provide a definitive account of those events, but rather to use them as a window into the emerging intersections and blurring of boundaries between the mass and interpersonal forms of social engineering discussed in the last several chapters. Though we will also discuss more recent examples of the practices of masspersonal social engineering, the 2016 case remains the most well documented. Because of this, the 2016 Russian operation and Cambridge Analytica will be our primary focus in this chapter.

到目前为止，我们已经讨论了“社会工程”这一具有挑衅性的术语，追寻其起源并追溯其实践。我们认为社会工程在美国思想中有两种不同的含义。一种是我们一直称之为“大众社会工程”的形式，这种心态可以追溯到 20 世纪早期的进步时代，认为社会是由不守规矩的人群和他们的精英上级组成，精英上级应该通过大众传播来管理这些人群。这种观点的支持者——艾维·李、多丽丝·弗莱施曼和爱德华·伯内斯——认为，对社会的科学分析揭示了潜在的规律，一旦理解了这些规律，精英们就可以实施一些计划，用精心设计的信息“设计出人群的同意”。他们的观点是，人群需要伯内斯所说的“适应”企业或政府精英的指令。2这样做会提高消费和生产的效率，缓解社会冲突，并为政府计划提供支持，包括发动战争。然而，到 20 世纪中叶，这种雄心勃勃的通过大众传播进行社会调整的计划在很大程度上被非法化了。

So far, we have taken up the provocative phrase, “social engineering,” pursuing its genealogy and tracing its practices. We argued that social engineering has two distinct meanings in American thought. One is the form we have been calling “mass social engineering,” a mentality that dates back to the Progressive Era of the early twentieth century and sees society as comprised of unruly crowds and their elite betters who should manage those crowds through mass communication. The proponents of this view—Ivy Lee, Doris Fleischman, and Edward Bernays—argued that scientific analysis of society reveals underlying laws that, once understood, allow elites to implement programs that can “engineer the consent” of crowds with carefully crafted messages. Their vision was of the crowd as something in need of, as Bernays puts it, “adjusting” to the dictates of corporate or government elites.2 Doing so would increase the efficiency of consumption and production, ease social conflicts, and provide support for government programs, including war-making. However, this ambitious program of social adjustment via mass communication was largely delegitimated by the mid-twentieth century.

20 世纪 70 年代中期，正当大规模社会工程学理念遭到削弱时，社会工程学的第二个含义在美国思想中浮现：一种新的人际骗术，由电话盗用者和后来的计算机安全黑客开发。黑客社会工程学倾向于以个人为目标，试图操纵他们泄露敏感信息或提供信息系统访问权限。这种人际黑客形式的社会工程学与其前身不同，它并非从科学到实施的愿景开始——事实上，这种版本的社会工程学是“胡说八道”的委婉说法——但最终，随着计算机安全黑客在 21 世纪成为一个专业领域，黑客社会工程学也成为一个专业领域，利用社会科学向更广阔的世界解释自己。

In the mid-1970s, just as the mass social engineering idea was undermined, a second meaning of social engineering emerged in American thinking: a new, interpersonal form of con artistry developed by the phone phreaks and, later, computer security hackers. The hacker social engineers tend to target individuals, seeking to manipulate them into revealing sensitive information or giving access to information systems. This interpersonal hacker form of social engineering was unlike its predecessor in that it did not start with a science-to-implementation vision—indeed, this version of social engineering was a polite way of saying “bullshitting”—but eventually, as computer security hacking became a professionalized field in the 2000s, so too did hacker social engineering, using social science to explain itself to the broader world.

正如我们在引言中所说，俄罗斯的行动和剑桥分析公司都涉及大规模和人际社会工程。俄罗斯的努力针对的是大众，因为他们针对的是人群。但俄罗斯人还使用人际欺骗来实现他们的目标，例如对约翰·波德斯塔 (John Podesta) 的鱼叉式网络钓鱼攻击，或者互联网研究机构 (Internet Research Agency) 巨魔通过 Instagram 与美国人互动。剑桥分析公司试图通过使用选民大数据来影响国家选举。但剑桥分析公司对政治竞选活动的推销集中在其通过社交媒体将信息“微定位”到个人的能力上。至少，俄罗斯干预活动和剑桥分析公司都表现出与旧式大规模社会工程师相同的野心，但正如我们将要讨论的，他们还使用了黑客和电话飞客开发的更有针对性的人际技术。

As we argued in the introduction, both the Russian operation and Cambridge Analytica involved both mass and interpersonal social engineering. Russia’s efforts were aimed at the masses insofar as they targeted populations. But the Russians also used interpersonal con artistry to achieve their goals, as in the case of the spear phishing attack on John Podesta or Internet Research Agency trolls interacting with Americans via Instagram. Cambridge Analytica sought to affect national elections through the use of big data about voters. But Cambridge Analytica’s sales pitch to political campaigns centered on its ability to “microtarget” messages to individuals via social media. At the very least, both the Russian interference campaign and Cambridge Analytica demonstrated the same ambitions as the older mass social engineers, but, as we will discuss, they also used the more targeted interpersonal techniques developed by hackers and phone phreaks.

这就引出了我们更大的论点：俄罗斯的行动和剑桥分析公司在使用大众和人际形式的社会工程学方面，都代表着新的东西，是对以前社会工程学形式的补充或综合。大众社会工程学是在大众传播的背景下发展起来的。黑客社会工程学重视人际交流。俄罗斯的行动和剑桥分析公司依赖于两者的融合、流动，这种形式我们称之为大众个人社会工程学，它由互联网和社交媒体平台的独特功能实现，并将黑客和宣传者、人际和大众传播的工具和技术结合在一起。大众社会工程师使用广播和电视，电话飞客和黑客使用电话、电子邮件甚至面对面的交流，而大众个人社会工程师使用企业社交媒体：Facebook、Instagram 和 Twitter，它们具有一对一和一对多功能的特殊组合。

This brings us to our larger argument: in their use of both mass and interpersonal forms of social engineering, both the Russian effort and Cambridge Analytica represent something new, something in addition to or synthetic of the previous forms of social engineering. Mass social engineering was developed in the context of mass communication. Hacker social engineering privileged interpersonal communication. Russia’s operation and Cambridge Analytica relied upon a convergent, fluid mix of both, a form we call masspersonal social engineering, which is enabled by the unique affordances of the internet and social media platforms and brings together the tools and techniques of hackers and propagandists, interpersonal and mass communication. While the mass social engineers used radio and television, and the phone phreaks and hackers used phones, emails, or even in-person engagements, masspersonal social engineers use corporate social media: Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter, with their peculiar mix of one-to-one and one-to-many capabilities.

传播理论家奥沙利文和卡尔认为，大众传播是指“个人利用传统的大众传播渠道进行人际传播，个人利用传统的人际传播大众传播的渠道，个人同时参与大众传播和人际传播。” 3也就是说，奥沙利文和卡尔建议我们关注传播者的“互动目标”，而不是关注渠道决定传播类型，他们可能会将看似大众传播的技术重新发明用于人际传播，反之亦然。俄罗斯行动和剑桥分析公司都有类似的互动目标：影响 2016 年美国总统大选期间的民主审议和投票。然后，他们利用企业社交媒体的大众个人功能来实现这一目标。

Communication theorists O’Sullivan and Carr argue that masspersonal communication occurs when “individuals use conventional mass communication channels for interpersonal communication, individuals use conventional interpersonal communication channels for mass communication, and individuals engage in mass communication and interpersonal communication simultaneously.”3 That is, rather than focus on the channels as determining the type of communication, O’Sullivan and Carr suggest we attend to the “interactional goals” of communicators, who might reinvent what appears to be a mass communication technology for interpersonal communication, or vice versa. Both the Russian operation and Cambridge Analytica had similar interactional goals: affecting democratic deliberation and voting during the 2016 US presidential election. They then used the masspersonal affordances of corporate social media in pursuit of that goal.

社会工程过程

The Social Engineering Process

为了进一步阐述我们关于俄罗斯行动和剑桥分析公司是大规模个人社会工程的典型形式的说法，我们首先要关注一般的社会工程过程。在前面几页中，我们讨论了社会工程的两层含义，列出了社会工程（在所有意义上）通常运作的一般过程。

To further elaborate our claim that the Russian operations and Cambridge Analytica are exemplary forms of masspersonal social engineering, we first want to attend to the social engineering process in general. Taking up the two meanings of social engineering, in the preceding pages we’ve laid out the general process by which social engineering (in all senses) typically works.

总体而言，要判断其他事件是否为大规模个人社会工程的例子，我们的启发式方法是，如果交流实践：

Overall, to judge whether other events are instances of masspersonal social engineering, our heuristic is, if the communicative practice:

  • • 依赖于我们所谓的破坏，或者有关目标的密集数据收集；
  • • relies upon what we’re calling trashing, or intense data-gathering about targets;
  • • 利用他人可识别的借口或角色，但这些借口或角色是基于欺骗的，并掩盖了信使的身份；
  • • utilizes pretexts, or roles that are recognizable to others yet are based on deception and obscure the identity of the messenger;
  • • 涉及胡说八道的谈话实践——友好、欺骗和准确的混合，不分真假；
  • • involves the conversational practices of bullshitting—a truth-indifferent mix of friendliness, deception, and accuracy;
  • • 目的是洞察某些事物——思想、机器、新闻周期、选举；
  • • has the goal of penetrating something—a mind, a machine, a news cycle, an election; and
  • • 结合使用个性化、有针对性的信息和大众媒体信息，
  • • uses a mix of personalized, targeted messages and mass media messages,

那么这种行为就是大规模个人社会工程。相反，如果一种交流行为只包含部分但不是全部这些要素，那么这种行为可能就不是大规模个人社会工程。4

then the practice is masspersonal social engineering. Conversely, a communicative practice that has some but not all of these elements is probably not.4

这种启发式方法有助于避免常见的误区，即认为每种操纵性沟通行为都是社会工程。任何个人行为的存在（例如诋毁或胡说八道）并不一定意味着正在发生群体性社会工程。（否则，广告或政治演讲等行为将被归类为群体性社会工程。）当所有这些因素都存在时，就会发生群体性社会工程，社会工程师会流畅地从针对个人转变为针对群体，然后再转回来。

Such a heuristic helps avoid the common trap of thinking that every manipulative communicative act is social engineering. The presence of any individual practice—trashing or bullshitting, for example—does not necessarily mean that masspersonal social engineering is happening. (Otherwise, acts like advertising or political speeches would be classified as masspersonal social engineering.) Masspersonal social engineering happens when all these elements are present and the social engineer fluidly shifts from targeting an individual to targeting crowds and back again.

在过去十年中，这些广泛的措施得到了进一步加强——俄罗斯互联网研究机构和剑桥分析公司都明确指出了这一事实。由于这些案例极具争议性，因此有据可查，我们因此可以详细解释大规模个人社交工程的过程。

These broad steps have been amplified in the past decade—a fact made very clear by both the Russian Internet Research Agency and Cambridge Analytica. Because these cases are explosively controversial and thus are well documented, they allow us to explain the masspersonal social engineering process in detail.

Masspersonal 社会工程案例：俄罗斯和剑桥分析公司

Masspersonal Social Engineering Cases: Russia and Cambridge Analytica

垃圾

Trashing

让我们先从俄罗斯的破坏行为开始吧。

Let’s begin with Russian trashing.

为了开始行动，俄罗斯的行动必须仔细检查美国的数字垃圾，深入研究大量数据，以便找到有价值的信息。5例如，对克林顿竞选主席约翰·波德斯塔 (John Podesta) 的网络钓鱼攻击最初并不是针对克林顿竞选高级职员的有针对性的攻击。相反，俄罗斯人必须对一堆数字垃圾进行分类。据美联社报道，

In order to get started, the Russian operation had to wade through America’s digital dumpster, delving into massive amounts of data in order to find valuable pieces of information.5 For example, the phishing attack on Clinton campaign chair John Podesta was not initially a targeted attack against a high-level Clinton campaign staffer. Rather, the Russians had to sort through a pile of digital detritus. As AP News reports,

首批被攻击的人之一是拉胡尔·斯里尼瓦桑，他曾于 2008 年在德克萨斯州担任克林顿的组织者——这是他在政治领域的第一份有偿工作。斯里尼瓦桑现在是奥斯汀的立法工作人员，当美联社告诉他黑客曾试图入侵他 2008 年的电子邮箱时，他惊呆了——他说这个地址已经停用了近十年。

“他们可能从互联网上搜集了这些东西，”他说。

几乎在最初的攻击浪潮中，其他被攻击的人都和斯里尼瓦桑一样，都是 2008 年的一名员工，他的电子邮箱地址已经失效，但不知何故仍留在网上。6

One of the first people targeted was Rahul Sreenivasan, who had worked as a Clinton organizer in Texas in 2008—his first paid job in politics. Sreenivasan, now a legislative staffer in Austin, was dumbfounded when told by the AP that hackers had tried to break into his 2008 email—an address he said had been dead for nearly a decade.

“They probably crawled the internet for this stuff,” he said.

Almost everyone else targeted in the initial wave was, like Sreenivasan, a 2008 staffer whose defunct email address had somehow lingered online.6

当然，斯里尼瓦桑忘记了自己的旧电子邮件地址也是情有可原的。就像我们许多人一样，他在职业生涯的这一阶段结束后就把它扔掉了。经过几轮调查，俄罗斯的 Fancy Bear 团队才找到活跃的电子邮件账户，缩小了目标范围，并最终向毫无戒心的约翰·波德斯塔发送了一个恶意的欺骗链接。就像电话公司的垃圾箱一样，互联网本身也包含过时和废弃的信息，必须仔细筛选才能收集到足够的信息来完善攻击。

Sreenivasan is of course forgiven for forgetting all about an old email address of his. Like many of us might, he threw it away when that part of his career was over. It took several waves of working through similar discarded email addresses that were known to be registered with the hillaryclinton.com domain before Russia’s Fancy Bear team found active email accounts, narrowed their list of targets, and eventually sent a malicious spoofed link to an unsuspecting John Podesta. Like the trash bins behind the phone company, the internet itself contained out-of-date and discarded information that had to be sifted through to glean enough to refine an attack.

至于互联网研究机构及其社交媒体喷子，美国司法部对其 12 名员工的起诉书声称，他们的破坏行为早在 2014 年 5 月就开始了，当时 IRA 开始讨论干预即将到来的美国总统大选，并开始“监视美国社交媒体账户和其他有关 2016 年美国总统大选的信息来源。” 7更具体地说，起诉书解释说，IRA
